The multi-layered process is, on every level, guided by the ideas and desires of the local community with whom we work. Through reconnecting displaced communities with food production from urban agricultural practices, we try to create opportunities for local empowerment and economic development. الأسطح الخضراء ، هي منظمة غير ربحية حديثة الإنشاء، تعنى باستصلاح أسطح البيوت بهدف إنشاء حدائق زراعية حضرية في المخيمات الفلسطينية، يدار المشروع بالكامل من قبل مطوعين شغوفين وعلى دراية بعلم الزراعة الحضرية والتصميم، يشاركون خبراتهم بهدف تأمين حياه غذائية مستدامة لإثراء الزراعة الحضرية في المخيمات الفلسطينية، تعتمد مراحل البناء على حاجات المجتمع المحلي في المخيم معتمداً على أفكار وإقتراحات الأهالي، وبذلك نقوم بتمكين ووصل مجتمع الاجئين بالزراعة من جديد مما يمكنهم من إنتاج غذاهم بنفسهم مما يحسن وضعهم الإقتصادي والمادي Opening our first experimental garden on the rooftop of ‘Jadal for Knowledge and Culture’ in Amman enriched us with the essential experience of urban farming in the challenging natural conditions of the Middle East. Meeting a great amount of people that share a similar mindset and vision gives our team the motivation to start with the next phase: implementing the urban farming project in Jerash Refugee Camp.  مخطط المشروع : ساعدنا إنشاء الحديقة التجريبية في جدل الثقافي في عمان على تحسين وتطوير درايتنا وفهمنا للوضع العام في المنطقة ومدى تأثير مشروعنا على الوضع الراهن كما أن تعرفنا على أناس يحملون نفس انماط تفكيرنا ساعدنا كثيراً على تحسين وتطوير خطة جديدة محكمة للبدء بتطبيق المشروع في مخيم غزة في جرشWith the help of your donation, we will add a next chapter to Greening The Camps’ story. We are currently working on our Pilot Project in the camp by greening the rooftop of a vocational training school. This school will enable Palestinian refugees in the camp to learn new professional and creative skills. This initiative offers an open platform for learning and a social space where cultural activities and sharing knowledge is key. The cooperation between Greening The Camps and the vocational school will turn the rooftop into a great meeting point for people who share a similar mindset and vision and who are interested in the project. By organizing  workshops about urban agriculture, creative waste management, building and maintaining installations and growing and harvesting crops, we aim to excite members of the community in taking part in the project. Within the next 6 months our goal is to build three additional rooftop gardens in cooperation with families. We will develop gardens that have been designed to be constructed with the bare minimum of funding.With your contribution you would help us build three rooftop gardens, and make Jerash Camp a greener space.  دعمكم المادي سيساعدنا على كتابة الفصل الجديد من قصة مشروعنا، علماً بأننا قد بدئنا العمل ببناء أول حديقة على سطح مركز شبابي تطوعي بالمخيم يعنى بالتعليم الإبداعي والحرفي لاهل المخيم، يعتبر هذا المركز أو المبادرة واحة تحتضن وتنظم نشاطات ثقافية ومعرفية في المخيم فمشاركتنا وتوصلنا مع مثل هذه المبادرة يساعدنا على توفير نقطة تواصل بيننا وبين المهتمين بتحسين وضع المخيم الذين يحملون نفس نمط التفكير الذي نحمله، سنقوم بتنظيم دورات مختصة بمواضع مختلفة حول الزراعة الحضرية ،الزراعة والحصاد ،إعادة التدوير وإدارة النفايات والبناء والتركيب مستهدفين أهل المخيم مما يرفع تأثير ومشاركة المجتمع المحلي في المخيم، نهدف إلى بناء ٣ حدائق سطوح أخرى خلال فترة ال-٦ أشهر القادمة في المخيم على سطوح ٣ منازل موجودة داخل المخيم، حيث أننا قمنا بدراسة ووضع خطة محكمة لبناء حدائق أكثر إنتاجية وفعالية بأقل كلفة، دعمكم المادي سيساعدنا على بناء هذه الحدائق الثلاث مما يجعل المخيم مكاناً أكثر خضرة                 Rewards€5 - Good KarmaSending you green vibes and positive energy! Thank you for being part of our story!€10 - Palestinian ChefThis is the easiest way to pitch in a few bucks and get a personal thank you card with a traditional Palestinian recipe on the back. €25- Urban Farmer Become an urban farmer yourself! Harvest your homegrown herbs and experience the Palestinian cuisine. You will receive organic seeds and a delicious recipe.  €50 - Green SupporterWhat better way to show your support than by doing your groceries while sporting a cotton tote bag with our logo. €100 -Urban Beekeeper Attract our buzzing friends with this handmade bee mansion. Bees will support you in making your urban garden a thriving bio-diverse oasis by pollinating your lovely crops. (Don’t worry, the bees that you will attract are solitary, and won’t have any honey to protect, so no bee stings for you.)€350 - Hummus Maker Stop throwing away your organic waste and see it for what it is: green gold. With this compact compost  bin you can turn your organic waste into valuable fertilizer for your own urban garden. This way your plants stay happy and healthy. €500 - Planet SaverAs a big thank you for your generous gift, we will plant a tree in your name. So besides helping us greatly with Greening The Camps, you will also make the air in Jordan extra clean with atree that bears your name! €1000 - Green HeroThank you for this beautiful gesture of support. For this or any donations above €1000 we will personally contact you to find a suitable way to show our appreciation.مكافأت التبرع : (النذر الطيب)، سنقوم بإرسال الطاقة الإيجابية وتمنيات الخير لك، شكراً لاهتمامك لتكون جزءًا من هذا المشروع/ (الطباخ الفلسطيني): دعمك ب-١٠ دولارات سيكون طريقة سهلا لك للحصول على بطاقة شكر على ظهرها وصفة طبخ لأحد الأطباق الفلسطينية التقليدية الشهية  (مزارع حضري) يمكنك أن تصبح مزارع حضري تزرع وتحصد انتاجك من الأعشاب الفلسطينية والتمتع بتجربة أطباق فلسطينية شهية حيث أننا سنقوم بإرسال بذور عضوية وعدة وصفات لأطباق فلسطينية مختلفة وشهية / (دعم للخضرة): لا يوجد طريقة أفضل لدعم المشروع من خلال إستعمال كيس قطني يحمل شعارنا تستطيع إستعماله خلال تسوقك (مربي نحل حضري) قم بجذب أصدقائك من النحل بعد استلامك لبيت نحل نرسله لك، سيقوم بيت النحل بجذب النحل ليساعدك على تلقيح نباتاتك ، لا تخف هذا البيت يجذب النحل الملقح وليس نحل المملكة، فلا تخف من اللدغ  (صانع الحمص ) :سنقوم بارسال سلة إنتاج السماد لك، لتحول مخالفتك العضوية إلى سماد مفيد ومغذي لنباتاتك لتبقى صحية وسعيدة  (منقذ للكوكب) كشكر وتقدير منا لكرمك سنقوم بزراعة شجرة تحمل اسمك حيث أنك لن تساعد المشروع فقط بل أنك ستساعد في جعل الهواء الأردني أنقىالبطل الأخضر .نشكركم جزيل الشكر على دعمكم، سنقوم بالتواصل معكم مباشرةً إذا كانت قيمة تبرعكم أكبر من 1000 يورو لنبدي إمتنانا  Urban agriculture is the cultivation of plants and animals in urban environments. In essence, it aims to be integrated in and intertwined with urban social, economic and ecological structures, but it can also be a precious source of both physical and psychosocial benefits for urban residents. It has a direct impact on urban ecology, improving both biodiversity and health. Organic waste, non-organic waste and wastewater are deployed and upcycled as valuable resources. This in return creates a healthier living environment. It transforms the passive consumer into an active producer who becomes aware of the opaque and hard-to-discern food supply chain that is entrenched around the world.  ترعى الزراعة الحضرية في اساسها الحيوانات والنباتات كما أنها تعمل على دمج المجتمع الحضري بالبيئة والإقتصاد ، كما أنها تسطيع الرجوع بالمنفعة النفسية على هذا المجتمع،بحيث أنها تؤثر بشكل مباشر على البيئة الحضرية من خلال تحسين التنوع البيئي والصحة بشكل عام ، فإنها تحول المخالفات العضوية والمياه العادمة إلى مصادر مفيدة وبالمحصلة الوصول إلى حياه أكثر صحية في بيئة صحية وسليمة، كما أن الزراعة الحضرية تحول الناس من مستهلكين سلبين إلا أناس منتجين واعين بأليات إنتاج الطعام واستهلاكها بالشكل الصحيحUrban populations have exploded in the last century, to the point that more than half of the world’s population resides in cities today. Generations are born and live solely in cities, severing the connection between nature and society. As a result, contemporary city dwellers have lost their relationship with the food supply. The distance between food production and consumption has resulted in the art of growing and harvesting healthy crops being lost. This vanished connection has an even more damaging impact on the climate and vulnerable ecosystems. Urban agriculture plays an essential role in changing this status quo for the better,  by creating an urban food system and propagating the creation of a circular economy where resources, produce and waste remain within the urban ecosystem. Whilst it minimizes contributors’ footprints in terms of transportation, food and water wastage, urban agriculture is about more than food alone; it is about sustainability, health and social justice. It is a reflection upon the scarcity of resources, upon our increasing disconnection with the environment and a bold experiment in tackling these issues whilst empowering communities.تضخمت المجتمعات الحضرية في القرن الماضي بشكل كبير مما أدى إلا إنتقال 50 بالمئة من مجتمعات العالم للعيش في المدينة الحديثة وبالتالي توالت الأجيال وعاشت في المدينة لمدة طويلة مما أدى إلا فقدان علاقة المجتمعات الحديثة بالبيئة و علاقة هذه المدن بإنتاج الطعام العضوي الصحي وزادت الفجوة شيئاً فشيئاً لتمحو فنون الزراعة والحصاد بشكل تدريجي وبالتالي إستنزاف موارد البيئة وتخريبها . وتلعب الزراعة الحضرية دوراً كبيراً ومهماً في أعاده الحياه البيئية السليمة إلا مجراها فالزراعة الحضرية تبني من جديد دوائر إنتاجيية إقتصادية وإستهلاكية بيئية، تستطيع إنشاء نظام إقتصادي قادر على الإنتاج وإعادة التدوير داخل دائرة محكمة دون الحاجة إلا إستنزاف الموارد الإقتصادية المختلفة مثل المواصلات والمياه بشكل كبير فالزراعة الحضرية لا تهدف لإنتاج الطعام فقط بل أنها تعمل على استدامة حياه إجتماعية كاملة وصحية بالإضافة لأمن الموارد وتوفرها . Agriculture is an important cultural tradition and heritage of the Palestinian refugee communities. The long running Israeli-Palestinian conflict has caused displaced communities to lose the connection with private food production and affordable organic food. The dense concrete fabric of the refugee camps lack the space and fertile earth for sustainable agriculture. This scarcity of green space in combination with a regional water shortage has caused a real and lasting disconnection between agriculture and a generation that has known only the camps. Rooftop gardens address this directly by creating a green oasis where a family or community can take charge of its own food provision, find rest and foster their connection with the natural world.لعبت الزراعة دوراً كبيراً في الارث الحضاري الفلسطيني منذ قدم الزمان إلا أن الإحتلال الإسرائيلي حال دون إرتباط الفلسطينين بانتاج غذاهم بأنفسهم من خلال الزراعة بعد ارسالهم للمخيمات، أضف إلا ذلك أن النسيج البيئي بالمخيم يفتقر إلى المساحة الزراعية التي كان يتمتع بها الفلسطينين في بلادهم عداك عن مشكله شح المياه التي تعاني منها المنطقة بالأساس وبالتالي وللاسف أدى ذلك إلا خلق جيل فلسطيني غير متصل بالبيئة ، جيل جديد لا يعرف شيئاً إلا المخيم وبيئته الفقيرة، تعمل حدائق السطوح بشكل مباشر مع هذه المعضلة وتحاول علاجها من خلال خلق مساحة خضراء تسمح للعائلات بأخذ السيطرة على إنتاج طعامهم بأنفسهم وبالتالي الوصول إلى نوع من الإكتفاء الذاتيOverall unemployment and the serious lack of self-esteem among women and youth in the refugee camps are pressing problems. Our project encourages engagement of women, youth and children in green and organic food production methods. The entire process is from start to finish designed with the families who own the rooftops. Improvements to food security, livelihood, creating a safe haven for women, youth and children and empowering people to explore and develop their talents and creativity are our ambitions,. As a result, one of our core principles is the involvement of the families in every step of designing and building the gardens. تلعب البطالة والفقر دوراً سلبياً في ثقة النساء والشباب بأنفسهم بشكل عام داخل المخيم إلا أن مشروعنا يعمل على تدعيم وتمكين هذه الفئات وأعطاهم الدعم النفسي من خلال تعزيز دورهم كعناصر منتجة ، ومن أهم اهدافنا في هذا المشروع هو تشجيع الأهالي بأن يقومو بتحسين أمنهم الغذائي لتحسين وضعهم المعيشي ، فعملية البناء لهذه الحدائق تعتمد بالكامل منذ البداية حتى النهاية على أراء الأهالي وابداعاتهم وتصاميمهم ، ستكون هذه الحدائق بمثابة جنة خضراء يستخدمها الأهالي ليستكشفو ابداعاتهم ومهاراتهم The first garden that we built is located on the rooftop of Jadal, a cultural café in the heart of Amman. This project brings together like-minded people; ranging from volunteers who helped us to build the garden to farmers and carpenters with whom we collaborated to expand the network of organisations that raise awareness for environmental issues. After the official opening of the garden we received nothing but positive feedback and messages from volunteers who want to join us on our green journey. On top of that, many people were inspired after seeing our garden to green their own rooftops in Amman. This first garden has been an amazing experience for us and by building and planting everything ourselves we gathered a tremendous amount of knowledge and technical skills. This experience will help us succeed in taking the next step: building three rooftop gardens in Jerash camp. After seeing what we brought about in Amman by greening a small rooftop, we are motivated more than ever to continue our journey and green Jerash camp. جدل : قمنا ببناء أول حديقة سطوح في مركز جدل الثقافي الواقع في قلب عمان حيث ساعدنا المشروع على إستقطاب متطوعين يعملون بنفس نمط تفكيرنا ويأتون من خلفيات مختلفة، فمنهم من كان نجاراً ومهم من إمتلك خبرة في الزراعة والكثير الكثير اللذين إستخدمو مهاراتهم وخبرتهم للمساعدة في البناء والتوسع والعمل على زيادة الوعي حول البيئة ومشاكلها ، تلقينا الكثير من الثناء والمدح من قبل الذين ساعدونا بعد الإفتتاح الرسمي للحديقة في مركز جدل والهمنا الكثير من الناس بعد خوضنا هذه التجربة المميزة، فرأينا أن المهتمين أبدو رغبةً بالطوع والقيام ببناء حدائقهم ومشاريعهم التطوعية الخاصة كما أن هذه الخبرة ساعدتنا كثيراً على التعلم وتوير مهارتنا مما سيساعدنا في أخذ الخطوة القادمة في العمل في المخيم وبناء 3 حدائق في مخيم جرشRisks & ChallengesAn important obstacle that we are facing in the camp is water shortage. With only 60 cubic metres of renewable water resources available annually per capita, Jordan is among the most water-scarce nations in the world. To supply adequate amounts of water for drinking, sanitation, industry, and agriculture, the World Bank estimates an annual per capita threshold of 1,000 cubic meters. On top of that, Jerash governorate has the lowest average of water share per capita within Jordan, with only 71 liters per day. The country is already being confronted with the effects of climate change and its resources are expected to diminish even further. At the same time, Jordan’s population is continuing to increase and the country has received more than 655,000 refugees since the beginning of the Syrian crisis. Factors such as these have resulted in the systematic overuse of its water resources for many years. If the nature and the extent of water usage are not reversed soon, the water security of Jordan’s population will be at serious risk. We will solve this problem with at least two availables techniques: rainwater harvesting and the reuse of greywater. Since winter is the only season with rainfall, we will accompany rainwater harvesting with the reuse of greywater from washing machines, kitchen sinks and showers, to flush toilets and irrigate crops. These two solutions will ensure that we will have adequate water supplies throughout the year.              يعتبر شح المياه في المنطقة عقبة كبيرة في طريق انجاح هذا المشروع فكمية 60 متر مكعب سنوياً تضع الأردن في مقدمة البلدان الفقيرة من ناحيه المياه، حسب إحصائيات البنك العالمي للمياه يعتبر معدل إستهلاك الفرد بالأردن للمياه حوالي الألف متر مكعب أضف إلا ذلك اقتطاعات الحكومة من كمية المياه المستهلكة بشكل عام وبشكل خاص في المخيم ليتدنى معدل الإستهلاك إلى 71 لتر فقط يومياً في المخيم، تواجه الأردن صعوبات الاحتباس الحراري ويتزايد عدد السكان بشكل مستمر وكبير بالإضافة إلى دخول الكثير من اللاجئين السورين (حوالي 655000 لاجئ تقريباً) منذ بداية الأزمة السورية مم أثر ذلك بشكل كبير على الخزينة المائية على مر عدة سنين مما يضع ضغوطات واخطار على المجتمع الأردني من ناحية توفر الماء إلا أننا قد قمنا بوضع حلول لهذه المشكلة من خلال طريقتين : حصاد مياه الأمطار وتكرير المياه العادمة .Help us Grow!  Spread the word by sharing this page with all your friends! Follow our story on social media. Like us on Facebook, follow us on Instagram and visit our website. Talk to us. We love hearing your ideas and feedback!Creating environmental  awareness is crucial, so spread some green love and tell your friends about it! Yalla, Spread the love and help us build a brighter and greener future!Thank You for your support! Team Greening The Camps

story:
Spirogyra fue fundada en 1992 por Sol Carballo, quien se dedico profesionalmente a la danza y a las artes escénicas y creció en este lugar, un pequeño oasis y uno de los últimos reductos boscosos situado en la rivera del Río Torres situado en medio de San José , la muy pequeña pero muy poblada ciudad capital de Costa Rica.Gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre ella aprendió a amar cada cada planta, árbol y animal que habitaba el lugar y cuando él murió  heredó el lugar,  dueña de un elefante blanco al cual cuidar con el salario de una bailarina. Con el fin de poder mantener la propiedad de 7.000 m2 y evitar tener que venderla ella  abrió un pequeña empresa congruente con su amor por la naturaleza: una finca de cría de mariposas. Sol  vive en la finca con su familia y cuida de ella con la ayuda de su hijo y un pequeño equipo de trabajo: un jardinero, una bióloga y un recepcionista y a través de este proyecto le ha sido posible conservar la propiedad y preservar el bosque secundario galería que hay en ella. 

 Spirogyra reproduce  aproximadamente 20 especies diferentes de mariposas y actúa también como agente para  otros pequeños criadores independientes.Muchos de estos son grupos de pequeñas comunidades rurales en los márgenes de bosques primarios, donde hay una presión constante sobre las áreas para extraer madera  o realizar agricultura de la forma tradicional usando pesticidas  químicos

Nuestro objetivo en estas comunidades es proporcionar una alternativa económica mediante el uso de estas tierras para un negocio eco-sostenible: la cría de mariposas, como una fuente de ingresos, mientras se mantiene un impacto ecológico mínimo.

Spirogyra was founded in 1992 by Sol Carballo, who was professionally dedicated to dance and performing arts and grew up in this place, a small oasis and one of the last wooded redoubts located on the banks of the Torres River located in the middle of San José, the very small but very populated capital city of Costa Rica. Thanks to the teachings of her father she learned to love every plant, tree and animal that inhabited the place and when he died she inherited the place, owner of a white elephant to take care of with the salary of a dancer. In order to maintain the property of 7,000 m2 and avoid having to sell it, she opened a small business congruent with her love for nature: a butterfly farm. Sol lives on the farm with her family and takes care of her with the help of her son and a small work team: a gardener, a biologist and a receptionist and through this project it has been possible to preserve the property and preserve the secondary forest gallery that is in it. 

Spirogyra breed aproximately 20 different species of butterflies  and is also an agent for a number of small independent breeders.

Many of these are groups of small rural communities on the margins of primary forests, where there is constant pressure on the areas to extract wood or perform agriculture in the traditional way using chemical pesticides.

Our goal in these communities is to provide an economic alternative through the use of these lands for an eco-sustainable business: the breeding of butterflies, as a source of income, while maintaining a minimal ecological impact.

 

 

Para que  necesitamos su apoyo

Es importante decirles que no es que Spirogyra Jardín de Mariposas deba impuestos, o que haya deudas o cosas que obliguen a cerrar la finquita, la campaña es para remodelar la infraestructura del jardín de exhibición para poder recibir más estudiantes, más turistas, más locales, más adultos mayores , más personas con dis-CAPACIDAD, en mejores instalaciones y manteniendo el costo de entrada tan asequible como lo ha sido durante todos estos años (20 años para ser exactos y es más económico que ir al cine o comprar una cerveza en algunos lugares) para que la mayor cantidad posible de personas conozca la riqueza de Costa Rica en recursos naturales y tome conciencia de la importancia de preservar el medio ambiente y mostrar que hacerlo está al alcance de todos !!!

Recibir más visitantes  permitirá  que Spirogyra Jardín de Mariposas continue trabajando para mantener y enriquecer  este bosque secundario galería,   productor de aire puro y hábitat para un gran número de aves, pequeños mamíferos, anfibios, reptiles e insectos, entre ellos, por supuesto mariposas.

Why we need your help

It is important to tell you that it is not that Spirogyra Butterfly Farm  owe taxes, or that there are debts or things that force to close the farm, the campaign is to remodel the infrastructure of the exhibition garden in order to be able to receive more students, more tourists, more locals, more seniors , more people with disabilities, in better conditions,  keeping the cost of entry as affordable as it has been during all these years (20 years to be exact and it is cheaper than going to the movies or having a beer in some places!) so that as many people as possible know the richness of Costa Rica in natural resources and become aware of the importance of preserving the environment and show that doing it is within everyone's reach !!!

Receive more visitors will allow them to continue  working to maintain and enrich this wooded redoubt producer of pure air and habitat for a large number of birds, small mammals, amphibians, reptiles and insects, among them of course butterflies

Our Investment Plan

Nuestro plan de inversión
story_txt: Spirogyra fue fundada en 1992 por Sol Carballo, quien se dedico profesionalmente a la danza y a las artes escénicas y creció en este lugar, un pequeño oasis y uno de los últimos reductos boscosos situado en la rivera del Río Torres situado en medio de San José , la muy pequeña pero muy poblada ciudad capital de Costa Rica.Gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre ella aprendió a amar cada cada planta, árbol y animal que habitaba el lugar y cuando él murió  heredó el lugar,  dueña de un elefante blanco al cual cuidar con el salario de una bailarina. Con el fin de poder mantener la propiedad de 7.000 m2 y evitar tener que venderla ella  abrió un pequeña empresa congruente con su amor por la naturaleza: una finca de cría de mariposas. Sol  vive en la finca con su familia y cuida de ella con la ayuda de su hijo y un pequeño equipo de trabajo: un jardinero, una bióloga y un recepcionista y a través de este proyecto le ha sido posible conservar la propiedad y preservar el bosque secundario galería que hay en ella.  Spirogyra reproduce  aproximadamente 20 especies diferentes de mariposas y actúa también como agente para  otros pequeños criadores independientes.Muchos de estos son grupos de pequeñas comunidades rurales en los márgenes de bosques primarios, donde hay una presión constante sobre las áreas para extraer madera  o realizar agricultura de la forma tradicional usando pesticidas  químicosNuestro objetivo en estas comunidades es proporcionar una alternativa económica mediante el uso de estas tierras para un negocio eco-sostenible: la cría de mariposas, como una fuente de ingresos, mientras se mantiene un impacto ecológico mínimo.Spirogyra was founded in 1992 by Sol Carballo, who was professionally dedicated to dance and performing arts and grew up in this place, a small oasis and one of the last wooded redoubts located on the banks of the Torres River located in the middle of San José, the very small but very populated capital city of Costa Rica. Thanks to the teachings of her father she learned to love every plant, tree and animal that inhabited the place and when he died she inherited the place, owner of a white elephant to take care of with the salary of a dancer. In order to maintain the property of 7,000 m2 and avoid having to sell it, she opened a small business congruent with her love for nature: a butterfly farm. Sol lives on the farm with her family and takes care of her with the help of her son and a small work team: a gardener, a biologist and a receptionist and through this project it has been possible to preserve the property and preserve the secondary forest gallery that is in it. Spirogyra breed aproximately 20 different species of butterflies  and is also an agent for a number of small independent breeders.Many of these are groups of small rural communities on the margins of primary forests, where there is constant pressure on the areas to extract wood or perform agriculture in the traditional way using chemical pesticides.Our goal in these communities is to provide an economic alternative through the use of these lands for an eco-sustainable business: the breeding of butterflies, as a source of income, while maintaining a minimal ecological impact.  Para que  necesitamos su apoyoEs importante decirles que no es que Spirogyra Jardín de Mariposas deba impuestos, o que haya deudas o cosas que obliguen a cerrar la finquita, la campaña es para remodelar la infraestructura del jardín de exhibición para poder recibir más estudiantes, más turistas, más locales, más adultos mayores , más personas con dis-CAPACIDAD, en mejores instalaciones y manteniendo el costo de entrada tan asequible como lo ha sido durante todos estos años (20 años para ser exactos y es más económico que ir al cine o comprar una cerveza en algunos lugares) para que la mayor cantidad posible de personas conozca la riqueza de Costa Rica en recursos naturales y tome conciencia de la importancia de preservar el medio ambiente y mostrar que hacerlo está al alcance de todos !!!Recibir más visitantes  permitirá  que Spirogyra Jardín de Mariposas continue trabajando para mantener y enriquecer  este bosque secundario galería,   productor de aire puro y hábitat para un gran número de aves, pequeños mamíferos, anfibios, reptiles e insectos, entre ellos, por supuesto mariposas.Why we need your helpIt is important to tell you that it is not that Spirogyra Butterfly Farm  owe taxes, or that there are debts or things that force to close the farm, the campaign is to remodel the infrastructure of the exhibition garden in order to be able to receive more students, more tourists, more locals, more seniors , more people with disabilities, in better conditions,  keeping the cost of entry as affordable as it has been during all these years (20 years to be exact and it is cheaper than going to the movies or having a beer in some places!) so that as many people as possible know the richness of Costa Rica in natural resources and become aware of the importance of preserving the environment and show that doing it is within everyone's reach !!!Receive more visitors will allow them to continue story:
*** DECEMBER 9, 2019 UPDATE ***

On 12/9/19 we received word that the Supreme Court will not hear the case. While unfortunate, this decision does not diminish the importance of this considerable effort to elevate this issue to the highest court in the land.

We fought hard for this issue and although we did not see the outcome we hoped for, it was worth the fight. We will continue to do everything we can to protect clean water.

Thank you to all our campaign backers for your contributions, which will go toward the $100,000 in legal fees incurred during this petitioning process.

The Supreme Court’s decision to deny our petition shifts the focus to the Trump Administration rulemaking on implementation of the Clean Water Act, including state authority under section 401. In our opinion, the proposed rule is misguided and largely unconstitutional, but done correctly the rulemaking could restore common sense to this area of law.

Your support for this cause remains vital, as the outcome will affect whether rivers across the country have sufficient cold, clean water. We encourage everyone to stay involved by following CalTrout and Trout Unlimited. The fight to protect clean water is not over!

Overview

California Trout and Trout Unlimited are teaming up to defend clean water across the country. We're taking our case to the U.S. Supreme Court and we need your help.

The ability of every state to enforce Clean Water Act protections on their own rivers and waterways is under major threat, an unfortunate and unintended consequence of litigation stemming from the Klamath River dam removal project along the California and Oregon border.

If a recent D.C. circuit court ruling stands, federal projects across the country—including hydroelectric dams and natural gas pipelines—could operate for 50 years or more without state requirements to protect river flows, water temperature, dissolved oxygen, and other variables that dramatically affect water quality and sustainability.

Our aim is to convince the Supreme Court to reinstate every state's sovereignty over its own clean water standards, by ensuring that states have adequate time to perform the required studies of the impacts of such projects.

100% of funds raised by this campaign will go toward legal fees associated with bringing our case to the Supreme Court of the United States. All donations will be split evenly between California Trout and Trout Unlimited to offset shared expenses.

The Case

 

The current case presented to the US Supreme Court emerged from the Klamath Basin, where a broad group of stakeholders—including California Trout and Trout Unlimited, the states of Oregon and California, the Yurok, Karuk, and Klamath Tribes, commercial fishing and conservation groups, and the electric utility PacifiCorp—reached a historic settlement to remove four dams on the Klamath River, the largest dam removal and river restoration project in the country.

The Hoopa Valley Tribe, which also supports dam removal, grew impatient with the temporary re-licensing tactics implemented by PacifiCorp that allowed the utility company to operate their dams without complying with the Clean Water Act and other environmental provisions. In an effort to expedite the dam removal process by ending the continuous temporary re-licensing, the Hoopa Valley Tribe filed suit against the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC).

 

The Decision

The circuit court ruling on the Hoopa Valley Tribe's lawsuit found that FERC was not required to expedite dam removal. The court also found that, despite the delay being agreed to by the utility to analyze the environmental effects of the project, the affected states had effectively waived their rights to certify that the project would meet water quality standards.

Thus, the court's decision weakened the ability for all states to protect their clean water through their own water quality standards.

Section 401 of the Clean Water Act (CWA) gives states the sole power to enforce water quality standards on federal projects within state borders—projects including the creation, operation, or removal of hydroelectric dams and natural gas pipelines. The catch is that the statute requires states to act within one year of the application. However, in most cases, one year is not adequate time to perform the studies necessary to assess project impacts on water quality and establish required conditions for complying with a state's water quality standards.

However, a procedural workaround evolved. Applicants frequently withdraw and re-submit their applications before the one-year deadline, in order to "reset the clock." This procedure has been used by states and license applicants around the country and endorsed by FERC, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), and federal courts.

The D.C. Circuit court decision is already being broadly interpreted as having negated this "withdraw and submit" process, and has quickly become a major threat to rivers across the country. Already, we have seen states' rights waived on rivers in California, North Carolina, and New York.

If this interpretation stands, federal projects could go 50+ years without state certification for water quality, leaving every state's precious waterways without protection.

California Trout and Trout Unlimited—with the expressed support of 21 states across the country—has petitioned the Supreme Court of the United States to reestablish the accepted practice of "withdraw and submit" as a means of enabling states to retain their ability to establish water quality protections for dams, pipelines, and other federal projects.

 

Downstream Effects

 

As a result of the district court's decision, an entire generation of hydropower dams could lose clean water protection for 30 to 50 years before they're up for license renewal. And it’s not just hydropower – natural gas pipelines are also outside of state control, as we’ve seen in a decision in New York. Since pipeline licenses don’t need to be renewed, the damage associated with such projects is permanent.

We have already seen the federal administration make regulatory rollbacks on the Federal Clean Water Act. States' ability to enforce clean water standards on federal dams and other projects is our last line of defense and we must protect it at all costs.

 

What’s next?

 

The case that California Trout and Trout Unlimited are bringing to the Supreme Court is our only hope.

21 states have submitted legal briefs in support of the CalTrout and TU suit, from California, Oregon, and Idaho to Wyoming and North Carolina. If the Supreme Court takes the case, it will be briefed in the coming year. We can’t do it alone!

 

You Can Be Part of this Historic Decision!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

There is a need for funding to cover the expense of litigation to elevate this case to the highest court in the nation -- the only venue that can reverse the problematic lower court decision. Litigation is expensive but is sometimes the only recourse for defending our bedrock environmental laws. The costs of litigation are high but the environmental costs of failing to act are far greater.

California Trout and Trout Unlimited have provided fantastic perks to help raise the needed funds. Perks include stickers, note cards, cups, hats, and exclusive trips. Scroll above to find out more about what you can receive with your donation today.

100% of funds raised by this campaign will go toward legal fees associated with bringing our case to the Supreme Court of the United States. All donations will be split evenly between California Trout and Trout Unlimited to offset shared expenses.

 

Want to Learn More?

 

Check out caltrout.org and tu.org for more information. Sign up for our email list and we'll keep you up to date on the latest developments, and alerts you when you can take specific actions to help protect wild salmon, steelhead, and trout.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Follow California Trout and Trout Unlimited on social media. Please help us promote this campaign - share this page with your family and friends!

- California Trout on Instagram
- Trout Unlimited on Instagram

- California Trout on Facebook
- Trout Unlimited on Facebook

- California Trout on Twitter
- Trout Unlimited on Twitter

story:
The Idea:

This summer, we plan on dropping our air-conditioned offices, put our life on the line for a good cause and getting ourselves a grand old adventure!

So, we thought, what’s more unpredictable than driving 16000+ km from Milan to Mongolia for charity in a old van whose most glorious days were back in 1970s? 

The overall situation should look something similar to this!

 

What is the Mongol Rally:

Easy, the biggest charity rally worldwide!

The race is organized by a British group called The Adventurists, and attracts teams from nearly every corner of the world. The route begins in London and ends 10,000 miles later in Ulan-Ude, Siberia. The Mongol Rally has only three very simple rules :

  • Teams must only drive a comically inappropriate car with an engine smaller than 1000cc.
  • Teams are completely and utterly on their own on the road without any backup
  • Each team must raise at least £1000 for charity.

And obviously, drivers are not given any advice or instruction on how to ride the 16000 km and arrive at their final destination...

Our adventure will take us through 20 countries, passing through ancient routes as the silk road and Pamir highway ( one of the highest road in the world )! We will depart from Milan on July 13 and, avoiding breakdowns, fords crossing and hawk hunters we are expected to arrive in Ulaan Udè by the beginning of September. From Milan we'll go to London and then througth the Balkans, Turkey and Iran, from where we'll enter in Turkmenistan and in the 'Stans republics reaching Russia and finally Mongolia. 

You may think think we will spend most of our time driving..but actually we expect to spend it like this..

     

    What We Need & What You Get

    In a word, money. But not for us. 

    This trip is going to be fully funded by us. It would be wrong for us to ask you for money so we can have our adventure. So all the money that will be raised will go to our supported charities Jaynepal and Cool Earth.

    • All we have to offer is this amazing adventure, and everything we can get from it. Pictures, videos, gifts, white russian with russian goat milk?
    • In any case everything we raise from this campain will go into charity, both in case we don't achieve our goal and if we overcome it!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    " I like them, but I'm sure they are going to waste all that money in White Russians and goat milk.."

    Well, first you can follow us on our FB page so you can make sure our goat milk consumption is adequate

    But we also have a big list of things we need for the trip, starting from tires, something to keep us warm when we'll be at 5000m, and probably a good sunscreen for the 40°C of the Gobi Desert...and yes also that leftover from the dinner with granma which will make us feel at home even after a couple of weeks...

    And here it is our glorious chariot ready for a night out!

    Thank You!

story:
In A Nutshell

The Buenavista National High School Environmental Club is a group of students dedicated to spreading environmental awareness through their community. In the Club's short life of only 2 years, the students have implemented many successful projects, including a mobile awareness workshop where they traveled to neighboring high schools, and the town's first ever environmental camp, which happened last October.

Now, experienced representatives of the Club would like to travel to Baguio City, where the national Youth for Environment Summer (YES!) Camp will be held this May 1-5, 2012. At the national camp, these students will share their Club's successes and become role models to students from all around the Philippines. They will also learn more about the environmental issues plaguing their country and how to continue educating the youth.

Bea, Jeremiah and John John, along with their teacher Miss Sadiwa, need your help so that they can make the trip to Baguio City a reality. Your contribution will go toward the 5-day camp's registration fee, as well as the travel expenses of the four people.

What We Need 

Bea, John Jake, Jeremiah and their teacher Miss Sadiwa will travel for 20 hours via jeepney, boat, bus and tricycle to reach the YES! Camp in Baguio City, from their town of Buenavista on the island of Marinduque. Once they arrive, they will pay a registration fee for the 5 day camp that will cover their food and lodging. That's where we need your help!

Cost Breakdown

$388 Travel from Buenavista to Baguio City (4 people)

$464 Registration fee for the 5-day camp (4 people)

$148 Processing and Handling Fees

TOTAL BUDGET - $1,000

The Impact

Through their participation in the Youth for Environment Summer Camp in Baguio City, our three outstanding young environmentalists will continue to be an inspiration to the youth of the Philippines. They will gain confidence through their interactions with national government officials, and will network with neighboring regions to continue the work that they have been doing. 

The Philippines is one of the most critically endangered environments on the planet, and the change won't begin anywhere else but with the youth. Our students recognize that fact and are working hard to make little big changes wherever they can!

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate your support, even if it is not in monetary means! You can help us get to Baguio by posting this campaign on your Facebook, and encouraging family and friends to donate!

story:
Discover How You Can Make A Difference and Change the World


Lemon Angels has a simple purpose: Help those who have been fed a "lemon" by connecting them with those who want to help, and see the results of giving. 

It's no longer about giving to an organization, its about seeing what difference you have made in other people's lives.

A Little About Me

Hi, my name is Paul Easton. I am based in New Zealand and I want to use the Internet to Give Away Fifty Million Dollars, while making a difference in families around the world....

Its about making a difference in people's lives and seeing the results of what you have given, whatever the size of help you provide.

Imagine being able to help a family that maybe has a child with a brain injury, and see what part you played in helping that family? Or giving to a family who has lost

Christmas presents, and then seeing the joy of them being taken shopping again.  Your kindness and generosity is rewarded with Video Proof Showing What You Helped Make Happen!

Our First Ever Online Event

Currently, although I have limited access to resources, I've put the very first event together. I am a person of action, so I got it moving anyway.

Lanai Carter and Her Son Lindsay

Watch the video for the full story of Lindsay and his Brain Tumour.





To View this Full Page Go to:

http://LemonAngels.com/lanai

What We Need & What You Get

  • We will need at least $3000 for basic web development and $2000 on top of that for marketing across Facebook to get this moving. Plus another $5000 for a PR company (with a view to getting on morning television)
  • More to the point - we need you! We want you to be a part of the journey, to spread the word about what we are looking to do, all over the world.
  • We need contacts!  Who do you know who could also come on board? Maybe you could invest and assist with resources. While money is great and it helps, contacts that you can introduce are the key! The Right People Power! These are people who might have a large following, or are professional speakers, or even celebrities who want to become involved.
  • We have set up a large range of perks starting at $5.00 up! 

Risks & Challenges

I know many online start-ups struggle to make progress .We will be different because of the following:

  • We will focus on spreading the word, getting a following, helping as many people as possible. This will make us popular for corporates who want to increase public exposure and brand association and who will be able to advertise on the site.

  • We will also focus on building  exposure, online and offline, with a public face (me). This is a major point of difference - personal accountability up front! Many donation websites are "faceless" non-people organizations. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page on Facebook.  The more people we can tell, the more people we can reach, and the more families we can help and the bigger we can grow.  We want to be truly worldwide! 

The last word - Thanks for reading this.  If you can help, great! Please take the time to comment, share and tell others - I am open to all suggestions!
story_txt:
Discover How You Can Make A Difference and Change the World


Lemon Angels has a simple purpose: Help those who have been fed a "lemon" by connecting them with those who want to help, and see the results of giving. 


It's no longer about giving to an organization, its about seeing what difference you have made in other people's lives.
A Little About Me

Hi, my name is Paul Easton. I am based in New Zealand and I want to use the Internet to Give Away Fifty Million Dollars, while making a difference in families around the world....


Its about making a difference in people's lives and seeing the results of what you have given, whatever the size of help you provide.


Imagine being able to help a family that maybe has a child with a brain injury, and see what part you played in helping that family? Or giving to a family who has lost


Christmas presents, and then seeing the joy of them being taken shopping again.  Your kindness and generosity is rewarded with Video Proof Showing What You Helped Make Happen!


Our First Ever Online Event

Currently, although I have limited access to resources, I've put the very first event together. I am a person of action, so I got it moving anyway.


Lanai Carter and Her Son Lindsay


Watch the video for the full story of Lindsay and his Brain Tumour.




  


To View this Full Page Go to:
http://LemonAngels.com/lanai
What We Need & What You Get


We will need at least $3000 for basic web development and $2000 on top of that for marketing across Facebook to get this moving. Plus another $5000 for a PR company (with a view to getting on morning television)

story:
AL Gore Climate Leadership Training

My name is Anne Cattermole .I live in a regional community in southern Queensland. 

As a parent,I have become increasingly concerned about climate issues and what kind of future is in store for all our children and grandchildren.

I have carried out several climate related activities this year ,including a World Water Day event.I run  a soil interest group and have other climate activities planned for later in the year

I want to do more in my community to inform about climate issues and to facilitate peaceful, effective action.

Several groups that I support invited me to apply for the Al Gore Climate Leadership training.

I applied and I have been accepted.

I feel honoured at the faith people have shown in me and I want to do my best to be a good climate leader.

When I complete the training, I have agreed to carry out ten climate related actions or events in the next  year.

This will be presenting climate issues to media ,community groups and politicians

I am just an ordinary working mum .My personal resources are quite limited.

The training event is being held in Melbourne  beginning June 25th 2014.

I need help to fund airfares and accommodation.

Any excess funds will be donated to a climate action group

Your contribution will help me make it to this once in a lifetime opportunity

Thank you

story:
Who I Am

My name is Jennifer Adams and I am a 2011 graduate of University of Colorado in Boulder.  More recently, I just finished with my 10 months of service with AmeriCorps NCCC.  It was through that program that I realized my passion for service and non-profit work.  So, after a couple short months of working at a bank, it's time to get back to what I love doing most - volunteering, connecting with communities, and bringing awareness to some very unique and amazing non-profits. 

My goal is to volunteer for approximately a year (depending on funding) in Central America with small non-profits and organizations.  I am addicted to non-profit work and even though their is a likelihood that this trip will end with a phone call to my mother, asking her to lend me money for a plane ticket home, or a bus ticket to my sister's house in Mexico, it will be worth it.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding I need for this trek is primarily just for travel expenses.  Exit and entry fees are common ($28 exit fee for Costa Rica, $10 entry fee for Nicaragua, $32 exit fee for Nicaragua).  I am packing a tent, so hopefully I can camp when housing isn't available.  However, especially when working with non-profits in an urban setting, housing will be a necessary expense.  It is because of this that I do not have a determined non-profit schedule yet - certain non-profits will be more feasible than others.  Closer to the funding deadline, I will be able to determine if I can afford to stay in cities to volunteer with non-profits (approximately $50-$100 a week) or if I will be limited to non-profits that can provide housing or have the area to provide a camping spot. 

The best part about helping to fund this project is that even if I do not reach my goal, this journey is still going to happen - it just won't be for as long of a period of time.  Every dollar can help - whether it pays for a night of camping, a bus ticket, or a taxi ride those last few miles to the small town where the non-profit is working. 
 
So what do you get? Unfortunately, I can't offer any prizes that cost a lot of money.  This journey is non-profit, and as every dollar I save means more time I get to help non-profits, I can't afford it.  However, what I can afford are gifts of creativity, art, photography, and my never-ending gratitude. I will write and record you a song, take a picture just for you, write you a poem, and send you a thank you note. 

The Impact

I can't quantify the impact my volunteering will make (yet).  On the start date of this campaign, I am driving to Denver International Ariport, and getting on a plane taking me to San Jose, Costa Rica.  From there, I am headed to Refugio Mixto de Vida Silvestre Romelia, where I will be volunteering as a research assistant for the refuge.  For an idea of where I will be, as well as opportunities for you to volunteer, go to www.tropicaladventures.com or check out Tropical Adventures on Facebook.  They are a registered 501(c)(3) with the IRS in the USA.  

I have the money to volunteer for approximately 3 months, including my trip to Nicaragua, which is necessary to renew my Visa in Costa Rica.  Hopefully, I will have the money to stay longer - I am trying to budget approximately $80 a month for expenses.  It is from there however, that I need your help.  I would like to volunteer with and bring awareness to other causes and non-profit organizations in the surrounding countries.  I can not only work for these organizations, but also spread the word about what they do and attract future volunteers.

Your contribution will fund volunteer work once I leave my research assistant position in Romelia.  Depending on the success of funding, I am looking to volunteer with several non-profits in Nicaragua, Guatamala, Belize, and Mexico.  Potential non-profits include: The Sweet Water Fund,

Other Ways You Can Help

I would love your help connecting with non-profit organizations or causes in Central America.  I have a list of organizations I have contacted, but if you know of any volunteer opportunities, non-profit organizations, or have family or friends in Costa Rica, Nicaragua, Guatamala, Honduras, Belize, or Mexico, please let me know. 


I would also love recommendations of hostels, gear, ways to get around - anything that would be helpful for a traveling volunteer on a budget. 


And finally, please follow my blog, twitter, and youtube.  Anything to help get the word out about these beautiful countries and wonderful organizations and causes I will be working for. 


Blog - www.wakeupandwander.wordpress.com

Youtube Name - wakeupandwander

 

Contact me at wakeupandwander@gmail.com

story:
EcoSynergy the farm of the future for 

          the people of the future! 

Our mission is to change the inefficient and harmful effects of agriculture. We have been farming the same way for thousands of years and little has changed. 

                                 BUT...WHY?

The answer is simple; big corporations  are heavily lobbying against regulatory laws that would prove their quality to be below that consider "SAFE". Both the USA & Mexico have suffered an exponential growth in Obesity rates that can be directly tracked to increase presence of substances like CORN SYRUP. 

Derived from corn as the name indicates. This "Syrup" is actually a chemical extract of a corn plant that has already been modified genetically, impregnated with countless chemicals & pesticides. Its high fructose levels have a destructive effect on our bloods levels of glucose. It also blocks a chemical reaction in your brain responsible of telling you when you are not hungry anymore. 

(Making you addicted to food)


Lets try a little experiment together;


Go to your FRIDGE

Open it, Grab 4 OR 5 LABELED PRODUCTS  AND LOOK FOR "CORN SYRUP"THE AMOUNT OF CORN SYRUP YOU CONSUMER PER DAY WITHOUT KNOWING. 

Its just horrifying.  

Not to mention the damage to the ENVIRONMENT. Corporations disregard quality and safety of the consumer


The REASON: Lower Costs


But what if we could find a better way of farming? A way of producing food without pesticides or modifications of any sort, 

in an eco-friendly way. 


That was the question in our team's mind,

 how could we redesign our farms to be efficient, safe and ecologically friendly. 


 And for a long time that question motivated us to do extensive research, to talk to the suppliers, vendors and to gain a knowledgeable insight  of the problem. 


The answer came to us as we stumbled on alternative agronomic methods. It was a surprise because the answer was so simple (yet not so simplistic), to farm using water without soil or Hydroponics

         

    

                    ...Thats how we developed a

                     new approach to farming... 


         WE BRING TO YOU 


                      The "Auxo" farm


HELP US HELP YOUR DIET, THE ENVIRONMENT & AND THE WORLD. 


Raising $30,000 we can build our "AUXO"  farm, capable of growing all sorts of berries, vegetables & other greenly leafs. This farm will allow us to perfect our system, lower total construction costs and develop a replicable model that is financially sustainable. Our farms can be easily transported and can grow crops anywhere regardless of the external weather conditions, something no other farm can do. Below are some of the benefits!

                                                      90% less water

                                                   10x times more food 

                                                      3x times faster 

                                 No chemicals, No pesticides, No Soil

       100% organic process



       Help us alleviate hunger!


ALL the production of our first harvests will be directed towards fulfilling our Contributors who helped us with the "Get your basket" perk and the to be donated to charity, helping undernourished children have a healthier diet.

WE are committed to help reduce hunger in the world and hopefully one day eliminate it. 

Even more important, we are convinced it will empower poor communities to have access to high quality food at an affordable price, like it should be. 


Our "ECO -Systems"

 Our farm systems are precisely design to utilize the least amount of resources while maximizing crop output. Using Freight insulated container to eliminate the risk of external changes in temperature as well as to maintain interior growing conditions. Each system has an independent, irrigation system, ventilation system, filter system, lighting system and access to clean energy through solar panels and Wind turbines. 

   

Just a thought...

What if i could feed you the perfect diet for you, at the perfect time, all the time? Well you will be the most healthy human being, and thats exactly what we can do for plants, without the need to modify them or add any sort of chemical we are able to provide the optimal growing conditions and diet so the plant as we say, "Grows Happy and healthy"

                    Blue prints (technical specifications) (Our Berry farm)

      

   

Grows of all kind of berries using a  Rotatory vertical cylinder system (RVCS). Equipped with an irrigation system designed to supply a constant stream of water throughout the middle of the vertical Cylinders, this unit saves space and water. The lighting system is tailored to this vertical growing method using hanging LED lights between each cylinder. In terms of production per square foot this is by far the most efficient model we have developed, capable of producing aprox. 1800 lbs of strawberries every 2 months. 


This is just the beginning!

If we raise the $100,000 we expect to build our advanced TRIO farm, a 3 unit container connected to improve resource utilization and increase yield production + FISH!

The "TRIO Farm" is a three container unit that is capable of growing all of the produce our AUXO farm is capable of, with a unique addition: fish.

                                                   FISH? YES FISH!!  

This unique farm is our aquaponis model; we call it the"Aqua unit". Designed with a special water tank capable of growing over 700 pounds of fish every six weeks with an ideal space utilization and water usage. The fish waste can be used as a source of rich mineral nutrients to feed the plants. These are synergies that occur naturally in ecosystems and that have multiple benefits. Boosting productivity, quality and taste of the produce; such as lettuce,tomatoes and/or strawberries among many others. 


Aqua Unit Blue prints (Germination stage included)


Auxo Blue prints (2 set ups: Berris & herbs, Vegtables)




I.C.M.S. or Interconnected Modular system (Patent Pending) 

 Connected throughout our unique I.C.M.S. or Interconnected Modular system that allows for an intelligent allocation of resources & Meta data sharing. 



      We believe on S.T.E.M.; the applicable academic discipline of Combining                       Science, Technology, engineering, and mathematics.

Each Unit has an intelligent monitoring system in charge of measuring, recording and analyzing all the elemental metrics of the conditions inside each container and stream live data to a central computer that can be accessed remotely via mobile app or via PC. This way we can measure, modify and optimize the synergies and conditions for both plants and fish throughout a comprehensive interface. 

                                                                *Yield*

To get a better idea, 1 Acre of traditional agriculture produces in 1 year in avg. about 45,000 heads of lettuce, our systems will be able to produce over 4 MILLION!! heads of lettuce per year!


Hydroponics has actually been around for Thousands of years!!

The famous hanging gardens of babylon, one of the seven wonders of the ancient world, were based on the principles of hydroponics. The aztecs developed a system of floating gardens based on hydroponics, driven out of their land, they settled in what is now Mexico City. Unable to grow crops at the lake shore they built rafts out of reeds and roots. These rafts were topped with a bit of soil from the bottom of the lake, and worked perfectly as growing platforms.  


Design Requirements (Technical Specifications**) 

A hydroponic system is designed to fulfill the specific requirements of plants with the most reliable and efficient methods) of nutrient delivery. The three major plant-requirements that a hydroponic system must satisfy are:

1) Provide roots with a fresh, well balanced supply of water and nutrients

2) Maintain a high level of gas exchange between nutrient solution and roots.

3) Protect against root dehydration and immediate crop failure in the event of a pump failure or power outage.

Hydroponic systems can be either active or passive. An active system includes a mechanical means for recirculating the nutrient solution, while a passive system relies on capillary action,absorption, and/or the force of gravity to replenish roots with nutrient. Besides being generally more efficient, and therefore more productive, a nice feature of active hydroponic system is how easily they can be implemented in an automated greenhouse.The automation system does not have to be complicated to provide outstanding results. Just as a fan may be connected to a thermostat to control temperature, a timer may be connected to a pump to deliver nutrients to the plants as necessary. If such a system is designed properly,a large nutrient reservoir could feed the crop for weeks before needing a refill. In this scenario, as long as the system is reliable, the garden will continue to thrive indefinitely without the need for continual supervision.
For a hydroponic system to be considered reliable, we must insure that the three major plant requirements are met on consistent basis. Efficiency is just as important because it will define your operating expenses, and in some cases can even disrupting the growing environment. The best way to build a reliable, efficient system is through intelligent engineering.

Partners & Supporters

We have the support & endorsement of one of Boston’s leading venture accelerators NU IDEA; that has provided us with valuable guidance, resources and capabilities.
In addition EcoSynergy has built a network of Collaborators, strategic partners, investors, entrepreneurs and well established Organizations in up to 3 different countries. The Center of Research Innovation at Northeastern University, Notheastern University, Bernardo O'higgins University in Chile, and the Innovation Centar at BBVA bank in Madrid, Spain among others.
We have also participated in venture competitions such as Innova-weekend, and we currently are in the process of entering Masschallenge (largest Global venture Accelerator). 

                                                           

                                                            

                                                         

About Us 

We are a Boston-based startup with the goal of providing  affordable high quality solutions to the existing food industry. Our mission is to make food assessable to everyone, everywhere, all the time. 
We specialize in sustainability, we strongly believe the cost to the environment should be treated as an obligatory cost to be paid to society. Our team has experience in the entrepreneurial world and has participated in several different Startup Accelerators while working side by side with one of the largest innovation centers in Europe. We started this company as a direct response to find a solution to the ever increasing threat food security poses for both developed and developing country.

Our Team

Ecosynergy™ team—the pioneers behind Ecosynergy Technology. We all bring unique expertise—from architecture to product design to Business Entrepreneurship to engineering. What unites us? Quite simply, a desire to help people find a better way to have access to affordable, healthy and local food, everywhere all the time. All while protecting the environment, Our principle is, "To get you must give" thats what Synergy is all about. 

 Use of Funds

We have talked to experts of the industry, done extensive research on the future challenges & opportunities and we finally have our designs ready to be built. With your help we will be able to fund and build our initial prototype. The more money you help us raise, the faster we will be able to achieve our goal!. So help us and JOIN THE SUSTAINABLE REVOLUTION!

Each system has an independent, irrigation system, ventilation system, filter system, lighting system and access to clean energy through solar panels and Wind turbines. 
   Just a thought...What if i could feed you the perfect diet for you, at the perfect time, all the time? Well you will be the most healthy human being, and thats exactly what we can do for plants, without the need to modify them or add any sort of chemical we are able to provide the optimal growing conditions and diet so the plant as we say, "Grows Happy and healthy"                    Blue prints (technical specifications) (Our Berry farm)         Grows of all kind of berries using a  Rotatory vertical cylinder system (RVCS). Equipped with an irrigation system designed to supply a constant stream of water throughout the middle of the vertical Cylinders, this unit saves space and water. The lighting system is tailored to this vertical growing method using hanging LED lights between each cylinder. In terms of production per square foot this is by far the most efficient model we have developed, capable of producing aprox. 1800 lbs of strawberries every 2 months. This is just the beginning!If we raise the $100,000 we expect to build our advanced TRIO farm, a 3 unit container connected to improve resource utilization and increase yield production + FISH!The "TRIO Farm" is a three container unit that is capable of growing all of the produce our AUXO farm is capable of, with a unique addition: fish.                                                   FISH? YES FISH!!  This unique farm is our aquaponis model; we call it the"Aqua unit". Designed with a special water tank capable of growing over 700 pounds of fish every six weeks with an ideal space utilization and water usage. The fish waste can be used as a source of rich mineral nutrients to feed the plants. These are synergies that occur naturally in ecosystems and that have multiple benefits. Boosting productivity, quality and taste of the produce; such as lettuce,tomatoes and/or strawberries among many others. Aqua Unit Blue prints (Germination stage included)Auxo Blue prints (2 set ups: Berris & herbs, Vegtables)I.C.M.S. or Interconnected Modular system (Patent Pending)  Connected throughout our unique I.C.M.S. or Interconnected Modular system that allows for an intelligent allocation of resources & Meta data sharing.       We believe on S.T.E.M.; the applicable academic discipline of Combining                       Science, Technology, engineering, and mathematics.Each Unit has an intelligent monitoring system in charge of measuring, recording and analyzing all the elemental metrics of the conditions inside each container and stream live data to a central computer that can be accessed remotely via mobile app or via PC. This way we can measure, modify and optimize the synergies and conditions for both plants and fish throughout a comprehensive interface.                                                                 *Yield*To get a better idea, 1 Acre of traditional agriculture produces in 1 year in avg. about 45,000 heads of lettuce, our systems will be able to produce over 4 MILLION!! heads of lettuce per year!Hydroponics has actually been around for Thousands of years!!The famous hanging gardens of babylon, one of the seven wonders of the ancient world, were based on the principles of hydroponics. The aztecs developed a system of floating gardens based on hydroponics, driven out of their land, they settled in what is now Mexico City. Unable to grow crops at the lake shore they built rafts out of reeds and roots. These rafts were topped with a bit of soil from the bottom of the lake, and worked perfectly as growing platforms.  Design Requirements (Technical Specifications**) A hydroponic system is designed to fulfill the specific requirements of plants with the most reliable and efficient methods) of nutrient delivery. The three major plant-requirements that a hydroponic system must satisfy are:
1) Provide roots with a fresh, well balanced supply of water and nutrients
2) Maintain a high level of gas exchange between nutrient solution and roots.
3) Protect against root dehydration and immediate crop failure in the event of a pump failure or power outage.
Hydroponic systems can be either active or passive. An active system includes a mechanical means for recirculating the nutrient solution, while a passive system relies on capillary action,absorption, and/or the force of gravity to replenish roots with nutrient. Besides being generally more efficient, and therefore more productive, a nice feature of active hydroponic system is how easily they can be implemented in an automated greenhouse.The automation system does not have to be complicated to provide outstanding results. Just as a fan may be connected to a thermostat to control temperature, a timer may be connected to a pump to deliver nutrients to the plants as necessary. If such a system is designed properly,a large nutrient reservoir could feed the crop for weeks before needing a refill. In this scenario, as long as the system is reliable, the garden will continue to thrive indefinitely without the need for continual supervision.For a hydroponic system to be considered reliable, we must insure that the three major plant requirements are met on consistent basis. Efficiency is just as important because it will define your operating expenses, and in some cases can even disrupting the growing environment. The best way to build a reliable, efficient system is through intelligent engineering.Partners & SupportersWe have the support & endorsement of one of Boston’s leading venture accelerators NU IDEA; that has provided us with valuable guidance, resources and capabilities.In addition EcoSynergy has built a network of Collaborators, strategic partners, investors, entrepreneurs and well established Organizations in up to 3 different countries. The Center of Research Innovation at Northeastern University, Notheastern University, Bernardo O'higgins University in Chile, and the Innovation Centar at BBVA bank in Madrid, Spain among others.We have also participated in venture competitions such as Innova-weekend, and we currently are in the process of entering Masschallenge (largest Global venture Accelerator).                                                                                                                                                                                  About Us We are a Boston-based startup with the goal of providing  affordable high quality solutions to the existing food industry. Our mission is to make food assessable to everyone, everywhere, all the time. We specialize in sustainability, we strongly believe the cost to the environment should be treated as an obligatory cost to be paid to society. Our team has experience in the entrepreneurial world and has participated in several different Startup Accelerators while working side by side with one of the largest innovation centers in Europe. We started this company as a direct response to find a solution to the ever increasing threat food security poses for both developed and developing country.Our TeamEcosynergy™ team—the pioneers behind Ecosynergy Technology. We all bring unique expertise—from architecture to product design to Business Entrepreneurship to engineering. What unites us? Quite simply, a desire to help people find a better way to have access to affordable, healthy and local food, everywhere all the time. All while protecting the environment, Our principle is, "To get you must give" thats what Synergy is all about. 
 Use of Funds
We have talked to experts of the industry, done extensive research on the future challenges & opportunities and we finally have our designs ready to be built. With your help we will be able to fund and build our initial prototype. The more money you help us raise, the faster we will be able to achieve our goal!. So help us and JOIN THE SUSTAINABLE REVOLUTION!

story:
Help Whalefish to support conservation of bottlenose dolphins in Argentina!

Within Argentine coastal waters, bottlenose dolphins have been among the most frequently observed dolphin species for decades. However, this situation has drastically changed! Recent research revealed that, due to the increasing amount of coastal development, today the famous "flipper" has become Argentina's most endangered dolphin! It is therefore essential to continue monitoring this population to ensure that effective conservation measures can be put in place to stop the population from declining. 

You must wonder, how is it possible to study an animal that spends most of its life underwater?

One solution is to identify each individual. Indeed, we can identify each dolphin through the physical characteristics of their dorsal fin and other parts of their body. Each dolphin can then be assigned an identification code and a name to help scientists recognise them when observed in a different area or at different times.
This method is known among scientists as “photo-identification” and is the fundamental basis for studying animal populations over time. 


That's why we are raising funds to purchase essential research equipment for our project that will be run by MSC Cristina Pinedo in Argentina under the supervision of our science director Dr Els Vermeulen and the support of the Whalefish Team. To read the profiles of these researchers, please see http://www.whalefish.org/#!our-team/c1qn


What we want to do specifically:

1. Continue monitoring the bottlenose population through photo-identification surveys. Data from these surveys will allow us to improve our understanding on the bottlenose dolphin's population dynamics (population growth/decline, mortality/survival rates, birth rates etc), movements and home-range.

2. Promote to tourists, local inhabitants and fellow colleagues the collection and sharing of systematic and opportunistic photographs of dolphins in the area in order to increase the dataset and our understanding of the species in the region.

3. Continue to increase the educational outreach regarding bottlenose dolphins in the area. We wish to build upon the educational book written by Dr Els Vermeulen in 2013 and continue to involve local schools both in the field and in the classrooms (Dr. Vermeulen's book can be downloaded for free via www.whalefish.org )

4. Raise awareness on the species in local inhabitants and tourists through informative brochures and talks.

Essential equipment we require to start the surveys:

1. DSLR camera + zoom lens

Specifications: Nikon D7100 - Sigma APO 70-200mm F2.8 EX DG OS HSM - Sigma 1.4 teleconverter EX DG APO Nikon - UV filter (lens protection) - Extra battery - Sandisk 32GB Extreme SDHC UHS 1

2. Garmin GPSmap

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

(Image: Yagui the dolphin calf)

story:
Short Summary

The first man-made wetlands in Maryland needs your support. Designed and installed over 25 years ago at a Buddhist monastery and temple, the wetlands have successfully received and treated all of their waste without chemicals or any other treatment. And now, some pretty serious maintenance is necessary to keep this landmark environmental experiment operating, setting a continuing example of what can be done when green is the goal.

What We Need & What You Get

In 1988, the oldest operating Buddhist monastery in Maryland, Kunzang Palyul Choling, ran afoul of state waste water discharge regulations when their old septic system failed. Keeping this original system in compliance would have required one of three expensive and environmentally adverse solutions, including chemical treatment and discharge into the Chesapeake Bay estuary. None of these were suitable for the philosophy and goals of the monastery and temple.

A new alternative, called constructed wetlands, was just being pioneered to protect lakes in areas where population growth was exceeding the ability of the land to adequately absorb the waste water volumes. Constructed wetlands work just like natural ones – the aquatic vegetation uses the nitrogen (ammonia) from waste water as fertilizer, removing it from the water table while supporting the growth of plants and the attendant life forms requiring this environment to thrive.

Mr. David Bailey, a temple member and water treatment expert, proposed such a constructed wetlands for KPC and, after educating state and local regulators of the efficacy of this new technology, secured the necessary permits to build and operate this landmark environmental solution, the first in Maryland and the Chesapeake Bay estuary. And we did.

After 26 years of continuous and successful operation, our constructed wetlands needs maintenance. The gravel beds have become clogged with solids, reducing water flow to the aquatic vegetation, and they need to be removed and replaced. Additionally, the aquatic plants themselves need to be cleared of invasive species and new plants installed.

There is an urgency to this project. The monastery discharges must be kept in compliance with waste water discharge requirements, and the work must be done before the first frosts so the aquatic plants have the chance to establish themselves. Otherwise, a temporary “pump and dump” system must be put in place to handle the waste water until spring. This is both environmentally adverse and very expensive, taking valuable operating funds from the compassionate activities of the monastery and temple such as feeding the homeless and animal rescue.

We need $33,000 to do this. Please help and become part of the “Brown Is The New Green” environmental movement.

The Impact

The use of constructed wetlands has the potential to change how rural and developing locations treat their wastewater. Many parts of the US and the world have no water treatment facilities. Constructed wetlands require few resources and none of the chemicals than industrial water treatment facilities use.

Risks & Challenges

Risk Number 1. We don’t raise enough to fund the required repairs. Without funding for this project, the monastery will be required to use holding tanks with a three-times-per-week schedule for removing the accumulated waste and taking it to traditional sewage treatment facilities. This service will cost approximately $1,000 per month and add to the chemical waste treatment load in the Chesapeake Bay estuary.

Risk Number 2. We don’t raise it in time.  The wetlands repair requires the planting of new vegetation and the preparation of the land for that so they can take root before winter sets in. Missing this schedule will mean no work can be done until the spring at a significant increase in operating expenses (see Risk Number 1) and the reduction of the compassionate activities of the monastery due to the loss of funds.

Challenge. Time is not on our side. The work must be done before the first frost to give the aquatic plants time to get established.
