story:
Turtle Sense is local program with worldwide implications. It is a great example of how the Hatteras Island Ocean Center is fulfilling its mission of revitalizing Hatteras Island economically in a way that is sustainable without changing the basic character of the area, thereby making Hatteras Island (part of the Outer Banks of North Carolina, and home to Cape Hatteras National Seashore) a better place to live and visit, by facilitating improved use of the Island's natural resources.

Turtle Sense technology is open source and all hardware designs and software source code will be available at no cost. All Turtle Sense data will be available to researchers everywhere. We believe that eventually Turtle Sense technology will be deployed globally, helping sea turtles and people coexist together better everywhere. For general information about Turtle Sense visit www.turtlesense.org. For more detailed technical information visit http://hackaday.io/project/2264-Turtle-Sense.

Please support Turtle Sense and the Hatteras Island Ocean Center and play a part in saving endangered sea turtles.

Why is Turtle Sense needed?


The current system used to manage sea turtle nests can lead to beach closures that sometimes last longer than a month. These closures can impact both people walking and vehicles driving.

What are the expected benefits?

  • Shorter beach closures.
  • Better protection of turtle hatchlings.
  • Improved opportunities for visitors see a nest “boil” and watch hatchlings crawl into the ocean.
  • Lower cost of nest management.

How does it work?


Small sensors that measure temperature and motion are placed inside the nest, on top of the eggs. Using mobile phone technology, sensor data is sent on a regular basis, via the Internet, for analysis. We hope that we will soon understand how to use the data to accurately predict when hatchlings will emerge from the nest.

Who is doing the project?

Turtle Sense is a joint effort of the Ocean Center, Nerds Without Borders, and the National Park Service. 

How is Turtle Sense funded?

All of the software and hardware development engineering has been donated by Nerds Without Borders. Seed money for production of equipment has been provided by an IBM On Demand Community grant and the U.S. National Park Service. The Hatteras Island Ocean Center conceived Turtle Sense and is providing support services.

Half of the money raised from this campaign will be used to help fund Turtle Sense and half will help support Ocean Center Ecology Park and the Ocean Center's ecology education programs.

Choose a Perk

Your support will help people and sea turtles, and you'll be part of making Hatteras Island a better place to live and visit. If you plan on visiting Hatteras, North Carolina choose a perk that will allow you to experience Hatteras Island's ecology and gain a deeper understanding and appreciation for the Islands's dynamic ecosystem. If you can't visit, your support is still important and you'll be helping to ensure that Turtle Sense technology becomes available worldwide and that the Ocean Center can continue its mission.

Thank you and please help get the word out about this campaign.


Our giant, guitar-playing, dancing turtle is looking forward to creating a custom thank-you message for you.

Do you want to explore the area by kayak or SUP when you take your nature tour?


Steve is looking forward to giving you and four of your friends a great aerial tour of Hatteras Island and the surrounding area.

In The News

  National Public Radio's Here & Now

Island Free Press

The Virginian-Pilot

The Outer Banks Voice

The Wall Street Journal Online

Island Free Press

Nextgov.com

EMSNow

story:
What is Project H2Know? 

We are a group of high school students launching a campaign to educate our community about the severity of the California drought and ways to conserve water. So far, Project H2Know has created and distributed over 600 flyers, 200 bookmarks, and a high-quality Public Service Announcement to middle and high school students, members in our local community, and even environmental group leaders. We are now launching this campaign to donate to our partner non-profit organization, the Water Education Foundation (WEF). All proceeds will go to the WEF to use for various expenses such as their water educational programs, water tours, stewardship, and Project WET - Water Education for Teachers. 

With your contribution, we can educate Californians and save water for a healthier California for years to come.

Why Water Conservation? 

Although our drought status looks grim, there is still hope. Research and data analysis done by the Santa Clara Valley Water District (SCVWD) shows that 10% of our usable water is credited to water conservation efforts. Current water conservation efforts are led by government agencies such as SCVWD and nonprofits like The Water Education Foundation and Acterra. These groups work closely with the community to impact our water resources which are a critical criteria for our community to thrive. Seeing the immediate need in our community, Project H2Know was created, determined to make a difference through spreading awareness and providing support to these established organizations.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $500 to help donate to the Water Education Foundation. The money will help fund Water Education Foundation educational programs such as Project Wet, which

And guess what? YOU as a contributor can receive some awesome items from Project H2Know in return! 

  • The $500 goal was implemented to insure your money will have a significant impact on this non-profit organization 
  • Our 80 member-base has prepared various water conservation-related gifts for you!


  • Rest assured - even if we don't meet our goal, all funds will still go to The Water Education Foundation 

Other Ways You Can Help 


https://www.facebook.com/ProjectH2Know

Even if you cannot contribute through monetary means, that doesn't mean that you can't help! Follow these tips to help bring California out of this severe drought:

  • Spread word about this campaign to co-workers, friends, and family! 
  • Like our Project H2Know page on Facebook to learn more tips about water conservation!
  • Share our PSA to everyone you know! The more who learn about the severity of the drought, the faster that we can get out of it.
story_txt:
What is Project H2Know? 
 We are a group of high school students launching a campaign to educate our community about the severity of the California drought and ways to conserve water. So far, Project H2Know has created and distributed over 600 flyers, 200 bookmarks, and a high-quality Public Service Announcement to middle and high school students, members in our local community, and even environmental group leaders. We are now launching this campaign to donate to our partner non-profit organization, the Water Education Foundation (WEF). All proceeds will go to the WEF to use for various expenses such as their water educational programs, water tours, stewardship, and Project WET - Water Education for Teachers. 
With your contribution, we can educate Californians and save water for a healthier California for years to come.

Why Water Conservation? 

Although our drought status looks grim, there is still hope. Research and data analysis done by the Santa Clara Valley Water District (SCVWD) shows that 10% of our usable water is credited to water conservation efforts. Current water conservation efforts are led by government agencies such as SCVWD and nonprofits like The Water Education Foundation and Acterra. These groups work closely with the community to impact our water resources which are a critical criteria for our community to thrive. Seeing the immediate need in our community, Project H2Know was created, determined to make a difference through spreading awareness and providing support to these established organizations.   What We Need & What You Get We need $500 to help donate to the Water Education Foundation. The money will help fund Water Education Foundation educational programs such as Project Wet, which
And guess what? YOU as a contributor can receive some awesome items from Project H2Know in return!   The $500 goal was implemented to insure your money will have a significant impact on this non-profit organization 

Our 80 member-base has prepared various water conservation-related gifts for you!


 Rest assured - even if we don't meet our goal, all funds will still go to The Water Education Foundation 





    Other Ways You Can Help 




https://www.facebook.com/ProjectH2Know
 Even if you cannot contribute through monetary means, that doesn't mean that you can't help! Follow these tips to help bring California out of this severe drought:  Spread word about this campaign to co-workers, friends, and family!  Like our Project H2Know page on Facebook to learn more tips about water conservation!
Share our PSA to everyone you know! The more who learn about the severity of the drought, the faster that we can get out of it.

story:
¿De dónde surge el proyecto?

Actualmente, la inmensa cantidad de residuos que llegan hasta los océanos desde nuestros ríos y costas ha puesto el futuro de esos ecosistemas marinos en situación de emergencia. Lo que hasta ahora era una serie de plásticos a la deriva se han convertido en compactas islas flotantes como la situada en el Océano Pacífico, con una superficie mayor que la de España, Francia y Alemania juntas. 

La situación de descontrol productivo que vivimos ha derivado en tal cantidad de plásticos en los océanos que la perspectiva a corto plazo ya augura un escenario donde por cada tonelada de peces podremos encontrar otra tonelada de plásticos. Y no hace falta avanzar en el tiempo para darnos cuenta de la magnitud del problema: más de 1 millón de aves y 100.000 mamíferos muertos a causa de la ingesta de plástico y el 100% de las especies de tortugas afectadas por la contaminación de los océanos.

¿Qué alternativa planteamos?
Creemos que existe la oportunidad de atajar el problema desde la raíz trabajando sobre los principales focos de contaminación: las desembocaduras al mar. La idea consiste en utilizar pequeñas barreras flotantes, apenas perceptibles a la vista y que no alteran de ninguna forma el hábitat de la ría, destinadas a desviar los residuos flotantes a pequeños contenedores previamente instalados. El aprovechamiento de la energía natural de la ría nos permite evitar el uso de energías fósiles en este proceso. Posibilitando así una transición hacia un modelo energético responsable y respetuoso con el medio ambiente.

Puede parecer que en tierras donde la gran mayor parte de lo que se planta son malas noticias, no hay lugar para las semillas de cambio. Sin embargo, de repetirnos a nosotros mismos "se el cambio que te gustaría ver en el mundo", hemos decidido dar el primer paso y embarcarnos en esta gran aventura. Para poner en marcha nuestro proyecto necesitamos de tu colaboración. Y siendo sinceros, el camino está lleno de desafíos, pero nos sobra entusiasmo. Con la ayuda de cada pequeña aportación, queremos dar nuestro primer gran paso, hacer realidad el prototipo de producto que hemos diseñado y ser capaces de instalar nuestros diseños allá donde las instituciones nos apoyen.

                                    ¿Dónde invertiremos vuestras contribuciones?
- En la producción de moldes que nos permitan la producción en curso de barreras flotantes de PVC resistente al agua y no contaminante, almacenes para la recogida de recursos y un montacargas vertical que permita la extracción de estos últimos.
¿Qué haremos con estos residuos?
Todo residuo que se recoja mediante estos procesos será llevado a una planta de tratamiento de plásticos para su reciclaje.
¿Qué haremos con los beneficios?
Se trata de una actividad sin ánimo de lucro, donde el 100% de los beneficios se destinarán a la producción de nuevas barreras de contención y a la retribución de aquellas personas indispensables para sacar adelante el proyecto.
¿Qué objetivos extra nos marcamos?
Por cada tonelada de plástico que recojamos, nos comprometemos al envío de filtros de agua para la potabilización a campos de refugiados, a través de ONGs.

¿Quiénes formamos el equipo?

¡Tres amigos, un  proyecto y la ilusión de llevar la contraria a las malas noticias!

story:
First of all, if you'd prefer to use Paypal, you can do so here.

The Guardian covered our pre-expedition planning last year, which you can read about here. I have also written about this ecosystem, which is locally known as the Hadabuan Hills, for The Diplomat and also for Asia Sentinel. 

I am the Project Coordinator for a small NGO called Habitat ID but our core funding has dried up, and crowdfunding campaigns such as this are what enable us to carry out our work, which includes camera-trap surveying to determine and monitor species presence, snare-sweeps, and logging patrols with our local partners the Sumatran Tiger Rangers, which is lead by an ethnic Batak named Haray Sam Munthe. We also help promote ecotourism in this area. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need money to buy more camera traps, Lithium batteries, SD cards, and protective metal cases for the camera traps because sun bears have destroyed several in the past. 
  • Donors will get copies of our best camera trap images and detailed reports from me personally. 
  • The funds are used to pay for supplies, guide fees, boat rental, and food provisions. 

The Impact

We feel that it is very possible that Hadabuan Hills, which is currently a kind of "leftover land" or unmanaged commons area, can be turned into one of Indonesia's best national parks. 

 

If you prefer not to donate cash, you can send supplies such as Lithium batteries, SD cards, and camera traps directly to me. Please contact me at: greg.mccann1@gmail.com if this is what you would prefer to do.

story:
What Roads?

The whole world is now talking about global climate, emissions while trying to find a way to find a more environmentally friendly way of transportation. The re-construction can only happen once and this is the point in history where we’re about to make that change.

We want to tell the story about the future of roads.  They are fundamental to our lives.  They have been a part of our societies since the beginning of time.  In our current age they have dominated the news and our lives.  Through the commute to work to how we live our lives when faced with the prospect of climate change.  They define our potential and our weaknesses – the car has become a status symbol of the modern world.   Yet the humble road that they travel on is undergoing massive changes.  How we live our lives are affecting roads.  Politicians are planning out how our roads and cities will look.   The roads that will be the veins and arteries of the metropolises of the future.  But are those assumptions they make correct? Are they making the right decisions?

 

How?

We are going to examine that future. Working with Salmonick Productions we want to show the world what the future may look like and how it will affect us.  Animation will allow us to show to the viewer how the concepts would look like in practice and allows us to examine the real situations.

Salmonick are brilliant animators from the Netherlands, who will help us to illustrate and demonstrate our future.   The concepts we will explore while they may sound familiar - will with animation be bought to life.

We’ve researched this subject and now we want to bring our research to the screen.

With interviews from scientists, engineers, politicians and academics we will examine the issues that will affect travel by road and the roads themselves.   We aim to show how the future’s uncertainty is leading us in many potential directions.  With critical analysis we want to show how the world may end up looking.

Throughout human history roads have evolved alongside us.  From the advent of the wheel to Roman roads, the horse and buggy and the internal combustion engine the challenges facing keeping humanity moving have evolved as our technology and societies have.

Why?

This is not the most obvious subject for a documentary it’s true.   But it’s a fascinating one.  With car ownership on the rise globally and travel and it’s “problems” dominating more and more of our lives it has become even more apparent that what the future holds will define us.

What We Need & What You Get

We've been chasing one professor for a while. He's based in Harvard and comes to Europe from time to time, but never to London and never on time. We've been speaking to him since the beginning of the documentary, when we came across his very exiting idea about a emission-free city. To get this interview, we need to cross the sea. 

We also need to attend conferences and discussions on this side of the planet, which we so-far have had a limited access to due to lack of funds. We want to be in the centre of the discussion and follow the decisions as they are being made.

Our animators also need to start building vehicles, cities and roads. They need to start putting theory into practice and create the future world we'll live in.

If we don't reach the entire goal but get some support, we'll start with the interview in Harvard, pay our animators and start looking for transitional means of funding until we can carry on. Having you guys on board would help us so much for that, as that would help us show that we have support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey guys if you see this and can't support please help spread the word - we really appreciate all the help we get to spread the word!

More updates to follow!

story:
NEW UPDATE  Click on the following link to monitor our progress

https://share.delorme.com/KarenMiles

UPDATE  Jan. 28, 2014  We have planned this trip again and are looking for paying participants to help defray the costs. With one month to go we have only 1 intrepid adventurer signed up. Regretfully one person will not cover the basic expenses of making this trip happen. So we are asking again for your kindness to help give these young Labradorians a chance to establish their own eco-cultural adventure business. You may want to read about the trip at our website at http://www.wanderbirdcruises.com/voyages-dogsled-expeditions.html#Wild and maybe you will want to join us or you may want to make a donation to help get this business started. Our goal is to involve as many young Inuks as we can afford to bring. They are a culturally rich people  who are loosing their traditional ways. There are still some young people. like Omma , who want to preserve the skills and knowledge that are rapidly dissappearing forever. What better way to learn, retain and use the old skills than to take people out onto the land to live for a week as the Inuit have for centuries. Please help us to help them.


Last year: We had originally set up this campaign by asking for about half of the amount we felt that it might cost to accomplish this and to finance the remainder ourselves. Your kindness and generosity is phenominal! The donations have wonderfully continued to come in even after we reached our original goal and they continue to help ensure that Omma's dream will now become a reality. THANK YOU ALL. 

Hi Everyone! My name is Karen Miles. I am fortunate enough to have been invited to join a dog sled expedition in Northern Labrador/Nunatsiavut. I am going to photograph and film this journey to help to document a vanishing way of life. Climate change affecting sea ice conditions and snowmobiles having all but replaced dogs have significantly impacted the traditional way of life for the Inuit. My work has taken me to the most wonderful places including Nunatsiavut and Labrador where I've had the opportunity to meet amazing and resilient people.

Three years ago Omma and his family gave me a beautiful husky pup and this experience has changed my life. I've always wanted to give back the same kindness and care. Some young people desire to practice and respect the old ways. One of them is Ommati. Those of you who have sailed with us in Labrador and visited Hebron know him as Julius Merkuratsuk. I have known Omma for 8 years as my husband and I visit his home in Nain, Labrador on our travels aboard our vessel Wanderbird (www.wanderbirdcruises.com).

Omma wants to live more in the old way, he loves dogs and knows how to run a team. So I am asking you kind friends for some asistance to help Omma join me on this amazing dogsled journey. We will travel over 1,000 km round trip.  This request is NOT for myself but for Omma. We need to purchase air tickets for him to meet with us in Goose Bay Labrador and for misc expenses like lodging for him before and after the trip.

Our wish is to help a young Inuk discover an important part of his culture. We will continue to encourage him to one day have his own dog team.

It is Omma's dream to be able to offer (in the form of tourism) the experience of living off the land and traveling by dog team in Nunatsiavut. Please help us so that we can make this happen for 16 year old Ommati Merkuratsuk.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We would need a round trip air ticket for Omma from Nain to Goosebay and return $1200 We would need 5 nights of lodging in Goose Bay Prior to departure and after retiurn  $690 and emergency snow mobile rental for backup and safety $3000 We would need food and some proper gear for Ommati $600. We would also like to bring some other young people on this expedition to help them to learn the skills of their ancestors.

In return for your donation we will ask Ommati to sign and date a hand carved and hand printed arctic themed card by Karen Miles.

THANK YOU for helping us to make this dream come true for Ommati Merkuratsuk.

story:
Hello People out here, 

my name is Róża Michalec and Florian Widemann. We are volunteers for the Eco Village project and we need donations for a cow and a biogas system. 

Why do we need it?

We have created a school called "Mile Child" for childeren, whose parents are not able to afford an appropriate education for their offsprings. 

We plant crops like corn, cabbage, mangos, avocados, tomatoes and cassava on our farm to provide food for the school children, in order to keep the costs for them as low as possible. 

To extend the diversity of nutrition for our pupils, we wan't to keep a cow on our farm and combine it with a biogas system, to utilize the outcome of our cow more efficiently and to approach our vison of a sustainable living. 

Furthermore, we want to pass the offsprings of our animals to the people around the area. We have already started the process with chickens and goats, so it would be great if we can extend our diversity of farm animals and provide for the people here a better living standard. The idea should also encourage them to follow the path of an Eco Village and to work as a unity.

The shelter for the cow is already constructed. So we need donations at about 1000 USD to buy the ruminant, transport and materials for the biogas system.

On our Facebook page "EcoVillage" you can find pictures of the cow shelter, our Eco Farm and as well the school.
story_txt:
Hello People out here, 
my name is Róża Michalec and Florian Widemann. We are volunteers for the Eco Village project and we need donations for a cow and a biogas system. Why do we need it?We have created a school called "Mile Child" for childeren, whose parents are not able to afford an appropriate education for their offsprings. We plant crops like corn, cabbage, mangos, avocados, tomatoes and cassava on our farm to provide food for the school children, in order to keep the costs for them as low as possible. To extend the diversity of nutrition for our pupils, we wan't to keep a cow on our farm and combine it with a biogas system, to utilize the outcome of our cow more efficiently and to approach our vison of a sustainable living. Furthermore, we want to pass the offsprings of our animals to the people around the area. We have already started the process with chickens and goats, so it would be great if we can extend our diversity of farm animals and provide for the people here a better living standard. The idea should also encourage them to follow the path of an Eco Village and to work as a unity.The shelter for the cow is already constructed. So we need donations at about 1000 USD to buy the ruminant, transport and materials for the biogas system.On our Facebook page "EcoVillage" you can find pictures of the cow shelter, our Eco Farm and as well the school.

story:
OUR MISSION

This April 27-29, Power Shift NY will be a mass gathering of young New Yorkers together in Albany for a weekend-long summit that will awaken and empower our generation to put an end to our addiction to fossil fuels by standing up for a green economy.

As climate change intensifies, New York State officials are making plans to allow dangerous hydraulic fracturing across a wide area of our state, putting the water, health and the climate of millions of New Yorkers at risk, all for for the dirty profits of Big Oil and Big Gas. Power Shift NY will bring together over 300 young people from all corners of New York State to unite in Albany for a weekend-long convergence that will train our generation to take bold action for a just and sustainable future.

OUR MOMENT

Power Shift NY will mark a turning point as young people of all backgrounds unite to take a stand and demand a just and sustainable future.

With powerful training and a bold vision, the collective power of young people will allow for game-changing action to create a livable future for all New Yorkers. Power Shift NY will give us the opportunity to harness our collective power and build a green economy from the grassroots up. Young people are disproportionately affected by the decisions made by those currently in power, but we’re not standing idly by. In 2016, our generation will be the largest voting block by age in U.S. history.  That's why we’re getting organized, we’re voting and we’re taking action in our communities. Power Shift New York will be a catalyzing force in the creation of a sustainable future for our state.

OUR CHALLENGE

From February through April, youth from North Country to New York City will collaborate and partner up with different groups throughout the state to recruit, organize and train a generation of activists through Power Shift NY.

We have a big task. Power Shift NY is going to bring young people together of all backgrounds for one huge weekend of social change.We are creating a network of high schools, colleges, universities, and non-student youth throughout the state that will work to preserve our future. We’re going to get our hands dirty building campaigns from the grassroots up that will organize our campuses, our communities and New York State for an unprecedented surge of youth action. Our task is no less than building an equitable, sustainable future, where a healthy environment is the cornerstone of sustainable economics and healthy communities.

Will you donate $10, $25, $50, or $100 to support young leaders to stop fracking and to build a green economy?

WHY DONATE?

We’ve had great success so far.

At Power Shift 2011, New York came back from DC with one of the strongest youth networks in the country, the Green Umbrella: NY Youth for a Just and Sustainable Future. Since April 2011, hundreds of young New Yorkers have taken action against Big Oil and Gas. In August, over 50 New York youth joined the historic Tar Sands Action sit-in in Washington D.C. In November, hundreds traveled to D.C. to hold President Obama to his campaign promise- "to end the tyranny of oil"- and we blocked the Keystone XL pipeline. When the fight turned to fracking in the Delaware River Basin, we teamed up with Josh Fox, Food & Water Watch, 350.org and frontline activists from New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Delaware to protect 15 million people's water and score a huge win in the movement to ban fracking. Since Power Shift 2011, we've been winning, but we have big challenges ahead.  

Youth have been a driving force in creating social change throughout history, from the civil rights movement, to the struggle to end apartheid, and now the international movement to achieve climate neutrality. As young New Yorkers from all walks of life, we envision a just and equitable society, powered by 100 % clean energy, and we are ready to take bold action to make this vision a reality. History is calling our generation to act, and we’re ready to answer.

What We Need & What You Get

We in the Green Umbrella are doing this work on a volunteer basis and many of us have already devoted not only hours, but personal resources to get the ball rolling. However, we can’t do it alone.  

Through our grassroots fundraising campaign, we aim to raise a total of $3,000 to pay for the conference space rental at the Hotel Albany. In addition, our registration fees will be used to pay for the training and program materials, including:

  • Printing training packets
  • Use of AV equipment
  • Supplies for break-out groups

We want you to be 100% confident that your donation will result in tangible social change. To ensure this, our team will send you updates on our progress via email.  


We want to extend our gratitude for your generous support by offering unique perks for donations!  We hope you can join us at Power Shift NY!

Other Ways YOU Can Support Power Shift NY!

  • Join us at Power Shift NY!  RSVP on Facebook to attend Power Shift NY.  Registration will be going live soon!  
  • Sign up to be a Campus Organizer or Trainer!  Help mobilize your campuses to get to Albany!  
  • Facebook: Use the power of social networking to help us spread the word about Power Shift NY. Post this site on your friends' walls, as your status, or send a friend a personal message!
  • Twitter: Tweet the link to this site! 
  • Email: Spread the word to your contact lists. Be sure to include this site in the email and encourage your friends to continue spreading the message.
  • Word of Mouth: Long before social networking, social change existed. Spread the word by starting up a conversation with a friend, co-worker, or a family member about how they can help to make Power Shift NY the best it can be. Pass along to them the link to our page and tell them to keep spreading the word!
  • Call: Don't forget the power of personal communication!  Give family and friends a call.  It will let the know you are thinking about them, and give you the chance to let them get involved.

story:
the Campaign, simple and straight forward.

Original music for digital download starting at $1.  Contribute and Share.  If each contributor gets two other people to contribute, we can reach our goal in less than two weeks. 

Oh yeah, and I'll be donating every single dollar from digital downloads to a cause benefiting forests in the U.S. 

about Michael.

I've been making music for over a decade, played hundreds of shows, received play on many college radio stations, and have met a lot of amazing people along the way that have inspired me to continue pursuing my dreams.  Because of them, I want to use my music to make a positive impact on the world.  

There were many causes I considered for this campaign.  In the end I wanted something that benefits everyone, and is something that I am passionate about--our Forests. 

why Forests?

Trees are the lungs of the world.  They are essential to keeping our planet sustainable.  As consumers, we don't always realize how our decisions affect our forests, and how making the wrong ones pose a significant threat.  
In the US, our Forests are thriving, and it's essential we keep it that way, as forests provide us with a great deal of benefits, including:
  • Clean Air & Water
  • Habitat for Wildlife
  • Healthy Soil
  • Recreation
  • Breathtaking Beauty
  • Jobs & Revenue
  • Products we use EVERY DAY and live in!
It's somewhat counter-intuitive, really...Often consumers operate under the assumption that if they DON'T use paper products, they are saving trees.  When in fact it's quite the opposite.  With over 90% of wood harvested in the US coming from Privately-owned forests, if landowners can no longer make money due to a drop in demand, it is highly likely that working forests will be converted to other uses, like agriculture, live-stock, or developments (housing, shopping, etc.)

what will $10,000 get?  and where will the money go?

All funding will be donated to the American Forest Foundation, which focuses funding from donations on sustainable forest management and environmental education.  $10,000 will Help continue the sustainable management of almost 38,000 acres and provide nearly 1,500 students with top-notch environmental education in the United States.   

some Fun Facts about Forests in the United States:

  • 1.5 billion new trees are planted each year 
  • There are just as many trees NOW as there were 100 years ago
  • The forest products industry provides jobs for 2.5 million people
  • Paper and paperboard packaging accounts for more than 74% of all packaging materials recovered for recycling.
Please be aware that I am not acting on behalf of any organization.  This campaign is based on my own beliefs and opinions based on the facts regarding forestry in the United States.  

*note, I do my best to deliver digital downloads within 24 hours of the contribution.

story:
Cannabis vs. Climate Change

Foreword                            

If you want to live, read this book.

“Cannabis vs. Climate Change”introduces ecological interrelationships of pivotal evolutionary consequence.Mankind’s peaceful existence, or our violent global extinction, will be determined by strategies initiated today, to repair Earth’s atmosphere.

Until now, all possible means for reversing global systemic imbalance have not been considered. Nor have all threats to our planet been factored into the equation of survival. The urgency of implementing the most effective measures possible, and due consideration of what is at stake, put all strategies to heal the atmosphere on the table for consideration.

‘Time’ is the only thing we can’t make more of. Every growing season that passes without the benefits of Cannabis agriculture is gone forever. Our species has an indecipherable number of planting seasons left, to resolve compounding imbalances that threaten everyone with systemic collapse of Earth’s environment, global economics and the human social order. 

A polar shift in values, from “illegal” to essential, is the evolutionary leap of collective consciousness required if humankind is to recover symbiotic relationship within a functioning Natural Order. Cannabis farming is Homo sapiens’ resource interface with the operating system of the Earth.

Cannabis is essential to our existence on this planet. The sooner we appreciate the world’s most valuable crop for what it is truly worth, the sooner we can begin to coordinate the large-scale planting needed; to maximize the chances for survival of  subsequent generations, following us into a very dangerous and unstable future.

For more than seven decades prohibition of ‘marijuana’ has stunted human development by blocking free market research and normal human investigation into all of the uses of all types of Cannabis. Blocking research and development of hemp-inclusive agricultural and industrial strategies has cost mankind more seventy years of working with our best hope for achieving sustainability. This book is a collection of history, research, formal study, and personal experience growing and studying Cannabis in Europe and the United States, unburdened by the limited thinking that comes with irrational social prejudice against an herb. 

An Inconvenient Priority

Most of us were born into a gigantic mistake called 'marijuana' prohibition. Since we grew up believing it was "normal" for Cannabis farming to be forbidden, we trusted and accepted that the government had good reasons and rightful jurisdiction over the most healing, nutritious, useful, ecologically beneficial, globally distributed and potentially abundant agricultural resource on Earth. Imposed values at the point of a gun ruled our thinking, individually and collectviely, and skewed our social evolution.

As the world races headlong toward tipping-points that threaten systemic collapse of environment, economics and the human social order, it appears that Cannabis agriculture is key to our continued existence on this planet for several importamt reasons. Like it or not, the fact is that Cannabis is too valuable to be within the rightful jurisdiction of any court because growing large quantities of it is critically essential to our survival.

Formal studies in ecology, years of living in wilderness and more than twenty years of Cannabis scholarship, photography and filmmaking have allowed me to connect dots between Cannabis and climate change that others have apparently missed.

Time is running out to resolve climate imbalance. Solar UV-B radiation is increasing as the result of ozone depletion and the loss of atmospheric aerosols, resulting from the death of 50% of Earth's boreal forests in the past sixty years. Unless we stop the "global broiling" of the Earth our children will inherit an unthinkable future.

For future generations to inherit a liveable world, our generation must achieve a polar shift in Cannabis values, from "illegal" to essential -- in record time.

Time is the limiting factor in the equation of survival.

Can you help me to finish writing "Cannabis vs. Climate Change"

Anyone who contributes to the completion of this book will be acknowledged (unless anonimity is desired) in the book as having made its publication possible. 

Post publication

After the book is published this Fall, my plan is to roll out on biodiesel-powered multi-media speaking tour, with my still photographs and a full-length digital video docmentary of the same name.

Introducing information and "connecting the dots" between Cannabis and climate will generate a groundswell of public involvement, initiating "essential civilian demand" for Cannabis at the federal level.A federal court case that's been stewing for three years provides the legal tool for establishing legitimacy facilitating public access to the most nutritious and potentially abundant source of complete nutrition on Earth.

We all know that twenty years from now, no one will give a damn who smoked "pot." But if we fail to do everything we can to stop climate change, our children will wonder why. It is madness that we continue to sell-out their future for a short-sighted fossil fuels fix, to satisfy our inherited toxic energy addiction, when we could be growing energy and food from the same harvest using hemp.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everybody knows someone who knows somebody else who has the vision, the means & the willingness to support radical change. Please, give it your thought and attention while there may still be growing seasons left for us to make a difference. Ask others in your circle of friends & family to get the word out. Thank you for doing whatever you can to help move this information to forefront of the global climate change discourse.

Sample chapters are available with your donation of $10 or more. A numbered and autographed collector's hardcopy of the book after publication is available for a donation of $100 or more.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help pass along this very good news -- there IS something we can do to stop climate change!

It begins with a simple shift in value from "illegal" to essential.

Thank you sincerely.

All our relations,

 

Paul J. von Hartmann

Cannabis scholar, filmmaker

story:
Conoscenza vuol dire sopravvivenza.
La storia

// Roberto Nistri // biologo / fotografo professionista/

// Davide Palumbo //biologo / esperto in eco-turismo/

Mi chiamo Roberto Nistri, sono un biologo e fotografo naturalista italiano. Ho "scoperto"  il Gambela National Park  durante un viaggio compiuto in Etiopia nel febbraio del 2011. I nostri fuoristrada hanno attraversato un territorio vastissimo, sconosciuto anche alle guide che ci accompagnavano. Una terra abitata da popolazioni tribali come i Nuer, agricoltori e allevatori di bestiame che vivono vicino alle sponde del Baro River e i cui bambini non avevano mai incontrato un uomo bianco. Un ambiente primordiale e incontaminato popolato da molti dei grandi mammiferi spariti dal resto del paese e da un grandissimo numero di uccelli. E che solo più tardi, dopo il mio ritorno in Italia, ho scoperto essere la seconda più importante area di migrazione di grandi mammiferi africani. Con decine di migliaia di antilopi endemiche white eared kob (Kobus kob leucotis) che attraversano ogni anno le sue savane e le sue aree umide. 

Oggi solo un turismo consapevole e rispettoso degli ecosistemi, strettamente collegato con le popolazioni locali, può generare un flusso di denaro che garantisca la sopravvivenza di un parco all'interno di una grande nazione dai moltissimi problemi qual è l'Etiopia. Trasmettere la bellezza e l'importanza di quest'area è probabilmente lo strumento più efficace e meno costoso per salvaguardarla.

Il motivo per il quale oggi sto chiedendo il vostro aiuto è che, in tempi brevissimi, è necessario generare un consistente flusso turistico verso il parco, che porti all'amministrazione i fondi necessari per la sua gestione, e al governo un concreto riscontro della straordinaria importanza che riveste, per l'Etiopia, per l'Africa, per il Pianeta, la sua conservazione.

Quello che voglio organizzare, insieme a Davide Palumbo, zoologo ed esperto in eco-turismo, è un RAVE (Rapid Assessment Visual Expedition), una spedizione fotografica, veloce e a relativo basso costo, che riesca a produrre delle immagini d’impatto da far circolare sul mercato internazionale. Immagini destinate a creare in tutto il mondo, attenzione, interesse, amore nei confronti di questo remoto, affascinante angolo di Africa.

Approssimativamente un milione di antilopi kob dalle orecchie bianche, elefanti e altri grandi mammiferi migrano nella regione transfrontaliera tra Gambela e Boma (Sud Sudan), in uno dei più grandi e spettacolari movimenti in massa di animali dell'intera Africa. Un prezioso ecosistema, questo, che necessita di urgente protezione. Insieme possiamo avere un ruolo nell'assicurare la sopravvivenza di un'autentica meraviglia della natura.

E' una missione molto difficile la nostra, lo so, ma non impossibile. Con il vostro sostegno ce la possiamo fare. Grazie di cuore.

Roberto Nistri

Davide Palumbo



Save the Gambela National Park, Ethiopia.
Where Knowledge Means Survival.

The story (english)

// Roberto Nistri // biologist /pro photographer/

// Davide Palumbo // biologist  / eco-tourism expert/

My name is Roberto Nistri and I am a biologist and naturalist Italian photographer. I "discovered" the Gambela National Park during a voyage to Ethiopia in February 2011. Our off-road vehicles crossed a vast territory, unknown even to our tour guides. An area inhabited by tribal people as the fascinating Nuer, who are for the most part farmers and cattle ranchers living near the banks of the Baro River, and whose children had never met a white man. 

A primordial and pristine environment populated by many of the large mammals disappeared from the rest of the country and a large number of birds. 

Only later, after my return to Italy, I figured it to be the second most important area of migration of African mammals, with tens of thousands of white eared kob antelopes (Kobus kob leucotis) crossing each year its savannas and its wetlands. 

Today, only a conscious tourism and respectful of ecosystems’ equilibrium, which are by definition closely connected with the local populations, can generate a cash flow that ensures the survival of a park in a great nation like Ethiopia, which has many more urgent problems, unrelated to the conservation of the wildlife. Capturing and sharing with the world the beauty and importance of this area is probably the most effective and least expensive way to protect it.

I am planning on organizing together with Davide Palumbo, zoologist ad eco-turism expert and with your help, a RAVE (Rapid Assessment Visual Expedition), a photographic expedition, fast, and relatively low cost, which is able to produce images of great impact to circulate internationally on the market. Images that are intended to create attention, interest and love towards this remote and fascinating corner of Africa, in the whole world.

An estimated one million white-eared kobs, elephants and other large mammals migrate in the transboundary region between Gambella and Boma (South Sudan), one of Africa’s largest and most spectacular mass movements of animals. This precious ecosystem needs protection, and we, together, can play a role in ensuring the survival of this natural wonder.

Knowledge is, ones again, the only path to survival. Not without precedents, we can actually operate to safeguard not only an area of incredible beauty, but of crucial importance for the future of the great African wildlife, even from far away countries.

 Our mission is very difficult, I know, but not impossible. With your support we can do it. Thank you.

Roberto Nistri

Davide Palumbo



Le spese

Abbiamo costruito il progetto partendo dal presupposto che dovesse essere il meno costoso possibile, per dargli le maggiori possibilità di essere realizzato in tempi rapidi. Due settimane di lavoro sul campo  in cui realizzeremo un reportage fotografico e giornalistico  il più dettagliato possibile sul parco, sulla sua fauna, sulle sue potenzialità dal punto di vista eco-turistico. Si tratta di un progetto il più possibile economico (considerando le difficoltà logistiche) e trasparente, vi elenchiamo sotto le varie voci di spesa nel dettaglio. 

Nel budget incide fortemente l'affitto dell'aereo per il sorvolo del parco, un cifra molto alta dovuta all'impossibilità di noleggiarlo direttamente sul posto, costringendoci a farlo arrivare dalla lontana Addis Ababa. Il sorvolo rimane tuttavia un momento fondamentale della nostra campagna, essendo l'unico modo di valutare non solo la presenza degli animali, ma anche la morfologia del parco, in gran parte attraversato da fiumi e caratterizzato dalla presenza di estese zone umide e quindi di non facile percorribilità con i fuoristrada. Questo nella prospettiva di pianificare dei percorsi eco-turistici al suo interno, fino nelle sue aree più selvagge e remote. Qualora non riuscissimo però a raggiungere la somma necessaria per il noleggio dell'aereo pensiamo, come soluzione di ripiego all'utilizzo di un drone, il cui affitto è sicuramente meno costoso, ma anche di utilizzare delle imbarcazioni per risalire alcuni dei corsi d'acqua che attraversano il parco. 


 2,000 USD - Biglietti aerei per due persone  andata/ ritorno Roma - Addis Ababa, classe economica.

1,300 USD - Assicurazione malattie ed attrezzatura, farmaci per terapia anti malarica (Malarone), visto di ingresso in Etiopia per due persone.

6,300 USD  - Land Cruiser 4 x 4, carburante, viveri, guide, supporto logistico per il campeggio (10-12 giorni), permessi di ingresso nel parco, permanenza in strutture alberghiere economiche a Gambela (1-2  giorni) per complessivi 15 giorni, comprensivi degli spostamenti da Addis Ababa a Gambela e ritorno. L'intera struttura è affidata ad un tour operator etiopico con base ad Addis Ababa.

7,900 USD - Noleggio aereo da turismo per sorvolo parco (due ore), con aereomobile proveniente da Addis Ababa.

780 USD - Editing e post-produzione delle immagini scattate, realizzazione di una photo slide dedicate al Gambela National Park.

720 USD - Regali per i nostri sostenitori.

1,000 USD - Spese generali di gestione del progetto.

Complessivi 20,000 USD.


The budget (english)

I built the project on the assumption that it should as inexpensive as possible, to give it the greatest chance of being realized in a short time. I envision two weeks of field work in which I am planning on accomplishing a photographic and journalistic overview of the park, as detailed as possible, including its fauna, and its potential in terms of eco- tourism. It is an economic project and transparent. Please find below the various items of expenditure in detail.

The budget is heavily increased by the cost of the airplane rental, due mainly to the unavailability of aircrafts right in Gambella region; we are therefore forced to bring one from as far as Addis Ababa. Flying over the park is infact the only way to assess the presence of several species and their number, and to understand the complicated morphology of the park, crisscrossed by rivers and swamps and very difficult to access by car. Our intention is  indeed to build ecotourism itineraries, deep inside the area, and we need to fully understand the situation. Anyway, in case we fail to reach the amount requested, we will use drones (much less expensive, although not as effective as airplanes)) for the aerial survey and boats to explore the rivers.


Below is the breakdown of the project budget:

2,000 USD - Flights for two return Rome - Addis Ababa , economy class.

1,300 USD - Health insurance and equipment, drugs for anti- malarial therapy (Malarone) , ethiopian Visa for two people.

6,300 USD - Land Cruiser 4 x 4, fuel, food, tour guides, logistical support for the camp (10-12 days) , entry permits in the park, stay in hotels in economic Gambela (1-2 days), for a total of 15 days consisting of trips from Addis Ababa to Gambela and back. Entire property is entrusted to an Ethiopian tour operator based in Addis Ababa.

7,900 USD - Rent to aircraft to fly on the park (two hours), with aircraft based in Addis Ababa.

780 USD - Editing and post-production of captured images, creating a photo slide  dedicated to the Gambela National Park.

720 USD - Perks for your contribution.

1,000 USD - Project general gosts. 

Total: 20,000 USD.

Conoscenza vuol dire
sopravvivenza.La storia
// Roberto
Nistri // biologo / fotografo professionista/
// Davide Palumbo //biologo / esperto in eco-turismo/
Mi chiamo Roberto Nistri, sono un biologo e fotografo
naturalista italiano. Ho "scoperto" 
il Gambela National Park  durante
un viaggio compiuto in Etiopia nel febbraio del 2011. I nostri fuoristrada
hanno attraversato un territorio vastissimo, sconosciuto anche alle guide che ci accompagnavano. Una terra abitata da popolazioni tribali come i Nuer, agricoltori e
allevatori di bestiame che vivono vicino alle sponde del Baro River e i cui
bambini non avevano mai incontrato un uomo bianco. Un ambiente primordiale e
incontaminato popolato da molti dei grandi mammiferi spariti dal resto del
paese e da un grandissimo numero di uccelli. E che solo più tardi, dopo il mio
ritorno in Italia, ho scoperto essere la seconda più importante area di
migrazione di grandi mammiferi africani. Con decine di migliaia di antilopi endemiche white eared kob (Kobus kob leucotis) che
attraversano ogni anno le sue savane e le sue aree umide. 
Oggi solo un turismo
consapevole e rispettoso degli ecosistemi, strettamente collegato con le
popolazioni locali, può generare un flusso di denaro che garantisca la
sopravvivenza di un parco all'interno di una grande nazione dai moltissimi
problemi qual è l'Etiopia. Trasmettere la bellezza e l'importanza di quest'area
è probabilmente lo strumento più efficace e meno costoso per salvaguardarla. 

Il
motivo per il quale oggi sto chiedendo il vostro aiuto è che, in tempi brevissimi,
è necessario generare un consistente flusso turistico verso il parco, che porti
all'amministrazione i fondi necessari per la sua gestione, e al governo un
concreto riscontro della straordinaria importanza che riveste, per l'Etiopia,
per l'Africa, per il Pianeta, la sua conservazione. 

Quello
che voglio organizzare, insieme a Davide Palumbo, zoologo ed esperto in
eco-turismo, è un RAVE (Rapid Assessment Visual Expedition), una spedizione
fotografica, veloce e a relativo basso costo, che riesca a produrre delle
immagini d’impatto da far circolare sul mercato internazionale. Immagini
destinate a creare in tutto il mondo, attenzione, interesse, amore nei
confronti di questo remoto, affascinante angolo di Africa.

e altri grandi mammiferi migrano nella regione transfrontaliera tra Gambela e Boma (Sud Sudan), in uno dei più grandi e spettacolari movimenti in massa di animali dell'intera Africa. Un prezioso ecosistema, questo, che necessita 
di urgente protezione. Insieme possiamo avere un ruolo nell'assicurare la 
sopravvivenza di un'autentica meraviglia della natura.
E' una missione molto difficile
la nostra, lo so, ma non impossibile. Con il vostro sostegno ce la possiamo
fare. Grazie di cuore.
Roberto Nistri
Davide Palumbo

story:
We rise by lifting others


My name is Preston Smiles and I am a messenger of love, committed to radical unity, and unbridled creativity and play. I am extremely excited to be sharing this beautiful gift with you. It is my belief that we get in life what we GIVE to life. And this summer in almost one month I'll be headed to Tanzania, Africa to build a clean water well with a non-profit called E.P.I.C (Everyday people initiating change). The portion I'm responsible for is 3k, it cost just over 15k to build it and make sure it will be sustainable for the next 20-30 years. 

The part B to the trip is I am going to be a representative of you and look for ways to be an angel for our family who doesn't have basic sanitation systems setup, electricity, nor enough money to boil the nasty water they fetch from water wholes miles away.  I need 100 people to give 40$ each and we'll hit the mark easily. No matter what you do or don't do I will personally cover it no matter what because I have sat in their huts,  played with their children and I know that if it was me I'd want someone like me to come support. So please dig deep and know that "you make a living by what you get but you make a life but what you GIVE."

I AM WE ARE #LOVESVOICE 

***Please donate and share this message***
PS I'll be documenting the journey and keeping you posted every step of the way

story:
If you'd like to donate now the campaign has ended, please click here. 

Update

We have begun work in the community of Lemolo B to build the community hub which will house the solar equipment. Thanks to everyone for getting us to this point. 


We have worked for years with communities in Africa and expert partners from top universities to help families. Together we can use clean, innovative technology to change the world. 

"Our Solar Nano-Grids project (SONGs) is bringing power and new business opportunities to remote communities in Africa. This project has the potential to lift half a million Africans out of poverty, improving their health, education and to create sustainable livelihoods". Dr Murray Simpson, as quoted in Travel Massive Article.



The Community of Lemolo B are looking forward to better lives with access to clean electricity:


Click here to learn more about the innovative ionQube recycled lithium-ion batteries. 

Click here to discover our ambitious plans to eradicate fuel poverty and improve wellbeing (working with Oxford University).

Click here for an overview of the project from our CEO, Dr Murray Simpson.


In the News


Take The #NoEnergyChallenge

 

Our Perks

Postcard Set - $10

Wristbands Set - $12

Fairtrade Tote Bag - $15

Grow Kit (Part of the Solar Powered Hero Gift Pack - $50)

Choose from Cottage Garden, Mixed Herbs, Sunflower, Peppers or Christmas Tree. Comes with instructions.

Cinch 4-man lightweight pop-up solar tent, WakaWaka Base 5 portable charger with torches and the PowerTraveller SolarGorilla portable laptop charger. (Part of the Solar Powered Family Gift pack - $4500)

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love any help in promoting our venture. Please share it on social media and tell as many people as possible. We believe this is the future!

Make some noise for SONGs!!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools :) 

#INTASAVEenergy and #SONGs

•  Our plan is simple - provide SONGs within communities who can not afford electricity, thus considerably improve their life opportunities. 

More information is available at our website.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Thomas Pirzl.

After spending many years developing one of the world’s first telecommunications and Wifi company, whilst on my global travels, I always came across the same problem… the latest technology in electronic devices, but problems keeping the batteries charged. This caused problems with maintaining contact with business associates and, of course, family.

Over the last years I have contributed to the building of solar farms around Spain, Today I work with Spain's leading thermal energy company, installing over 500 solar thermal energy equipment's each month all over Spain. 


"We are united by a dream to create a world where people never need to lose communication with their smartphones."

BENEFITS OF  THE KIT:

  • Charge your device directly from the SUN.
  • Store your FREE energy produced by the Sun.
  • Have a power source available at all times.
  • Connectors in the kit for all devices.

Communication devices such as mobiles, tablets or iPads have become indispensable items for everyone. The users of these devices expect an increasing performance and effectiveness in their use and operation. But, this means that the battery has a limited lifespan.

                               

Likee-mail Web

This universal, lightweight, functional and fashionable solar charger is perfect for anyone, in any part of the world, at any time to be able to charge their electrical device and always be connected.

TOTAL ENERGY LINE Kit

5.6W Solar Set TOTAL ENERGY LINE

  •  Solar panel: 5.5V/5.6 Watts
  • Solar panel quantity: 2 pcs
  • Max output:  5V/1A 
  • Folded Size: 320mm x 180mm
  • Net Weight:  About 320 Grams
  • Product Features
    Charge iPhone 5 directly  without the battery inside
    With a built-in smart chip, it has a unique automatic start function controlled by software.
    (On cloudy days the solar energy stops working, controlled by software, it automatically resumes charging the iPhone or iPad when the sun comes out without the need to plug in the connectors.)

Angled position support 

On the Road 

Storage pocket 

  Any TIME...

 Have the POWER..

 To be CONNECTED ...

Multi function Battery. Product Specification:

  • Battery type: Lithium polymer
  • Capacity: 3.7V/ 3,600mAh
  • USB cable input: 5V/1A
  • Output:  USB port: 5V/1A
  • Output:  Apple dock: 5V/1A 
  • Output:  Micro USB cable: 5V/1A
  • On/off button: press to start charging
  • Power display: 5 LED indicators shows power level, each represents 20% of battery usage
  • Size: 65mm x 108mm x 15mm
  • Weight:125g

    Product Features

    • Fit for iPhone design
    • 3,600mAh Lithium polymer battery, can charge iPhone 180%, iPad 40%
    • No boundary limit, used as stand of iPhond & iPad
    • Output with Apple dock and USB port, suit for all mobile phone and iPhone/iPad
    • USB input & Micro USB output cables incorporated
    • UV coating

    What Your Contribution Will Fund

    With your support, we can put TOTAL ENERGY LINE into people’s hands worldwide. Your contribution will help lessen the overall production costs. The more you order in bulk, the more we can cut the production cost, hence the better value for money.


    * FAQ

    1) What is the capacity of one kit?

    Solar Panel 5.5V / 5.6V

    Max output 5V / 1A

    Battery: 3,600mAh

    Output:  USB port: 5V/1A
    Output:  Apple dock: 5V/1A
    Output:  Micro USB cable: 5V/1A

    2) How many mobile phones can be connected to the set?

    You can connect 3 different devices at the same time.

    3) How long does the kit effectiveness last?

    The solar panel looses 10% of its production after 20 years

    The battery can be recharged over 500 times

    4) Shipping fee for multiple perks?

    1 shipping address requires a shipping fee, depending on location, unless it is stated free shipping. Otherwise, for any question or if you need help, feel free to contact us.

    5) Question:  I know sometimes on crowd funding sites the product never gets made.  Will I definitely receive my TOTAL ENERGY LINE KIT?,What if we don't reach our goal?

    For those of you who might be wondering, "What if they don't reach their goal? Where will my funds go?", we answer: they will all go into the production and delivery of your solar charger kit. The $30,000 pledge goal includes allocation of funds for expansion, such as hiring employees, marketing, meeting minimum order quantities to reduce costs, etc. If we do not reach our goal, we will forgo these expenses and put everything towards the production and delivery of your solar kit, even if it is at a higher production cost for us. You are our number one priority and your satisfaction is paramount. The total funds raised if we do not reach our goal will be allocated to creating a quality product for our Indiegogo backers. If you have contributed towards the product then you will receive it.



    For more information please contact us:

    Developer Thomas Pirzl:

    tpirzl@36grados.es

    tlf:- + 34 678857569

    Account manager Amy Hollis:

            ahollis@olasolar.com 

    tlf:- + 34 622587501

    Marketing Mª Ángeles Luis:

    aluis@iedes.com

    • Ask yourself:   Are you ready to be part of the TOTAL ENERGY GENERATION? ....then make a contribution towards a change in the energy World.

    In addition to our main team, we've assembled an incredible group of engineers, designers, and industry experts who are collaborating with us to create the best product possible. Our manufacturing partners include some of the biggest in the industry of solar sets. We also have lawyers on our team who shall deal with any legal issues if they should arise. Manufacturing deals with our partners have already been struck, and most of the logistic obstacles have been dealt with.

    What We Need & What You Get



    We have been working on the TOTAL ENERGY LINE for the past 2 years and we've come a long way, with the result being attractive and efficient chargers. We continued testing and increasing the power of the panels to make them more efficient and compact. 


    So far we have covered our expenses through investors from different Spanish companies and depleting our personal savings accounts and credit cards. We received a $15k grant from  IEDES Solenergy, and presented some of the prototypes at the Worldmotorbike GP 2014, to monitor it´s acceptation. We received a enthusiastic response from motorcyclist clubs, proving that there is a whole range of people that believe in our product!

    Manufacturing a tangible product on a large scale is just too much for a self-sufficient start-up. The current cost to manufacture a single unit in small batches is astronomical. This is where you come in. Your support will allow us to buy components in bulk, as well as initiate the tooling and mass production so we can bring the TOTAL ENERGY LINE to you and millions of people who believe that with the SUN and the POWER, you have the world in your hands. Let's make our Solar electronic device personal again.... together, we can do it!

    So why should you support us?

    • Be the first to get one (literally)
    • You believe in nature and the care of the environment
    • You want to belong to an exclusive energy club. 
    • You want to have the power everywhere and anywhere.
    • You want to have the freedom in nature and with nature. 

    Then make a contribution towards a change in the energy World.


    Find This Campaign On YouTube

     36Grados Total energy line 


    The Impact

    • Let's get rid of all those connectors you need for all the different devices necessary today and use the SUN to get the power all around the World.
    • We can do this... Be part of the solar revolution.


    Other Ways You Can Help

     FACEBOOK


    We know that some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Get the word out and make some noise about the TOTAL ENERGY LINE campaign.
    • Please remember to use the Indiegogo, Facebook, Google+ to share!

    And that's all there is to do to be part of the solution for everyone who wants to use, everywhere and anytime, their communication device around the World.

    ¡¡¡¿Cansado de quedarse sin batería?!!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Thomas Pirzl.
After spending many
years developing one of the world’s first telecommunications and Wifi
company, whilst on my global travels, I always came across the same
problem… the latest technology in electronic devices, but problems keeping the
batteries charged. This caused problems with maintaining contact with business associates and, of course, family.
Over the last years I have contributed to the building of solar farms around Spain, Today I work with Spain's leading thermal energy company, installing over 500 solar thermal energy equipment's each month all over Spain. 




"We are united by a dream to create a world where people never need to lose communication with their smartphones."
BENEFITS OF  THE KIT:


Charge your device directly from the SUN.

Store your FREE energy produced by the Sun.
Have a power source available at all times.
Connectors in the kit for all devices.




Communication devices such as mobiles, tablets or
iPads have become indispensable items for everyone. The users of these devices
expect an increasing performance and effectiveness in their use and operation.
But, this means that the battery has a limited lifespan.


                               
Likee-mail Web
This universal, lightweight, functional and fashionable solar charger is perfect for
anyone, in any part of the world, at any time to be able to charge their electrical device
and always be connected.
TOTAL ENERGY LINE Kit





5.6W Solar Set TOTAL ENERGY LINE
 Solar panel: 5.5V/5.6 Watts

Solar panel quantity: 2 pcs
Max output:  5V/1A 
Folded Size: 320mm x 180mm

Net Weight:  About 320 Grams

Product FeaturesCharge iPhone 5 directly  without the battery insideWith a built-in smart chip, it has a unique automatic start function controlled by software.(On cloudy days the solar energy stops working, controlled by software, it automatically resumes charging the iPhone or iPad when the sun comes out without the need to plug in the connectors.)
Angled position support On the Road Storage pocket 



  Any TIME... Have the POWER.. To be CONNECTED ...Multi function Battery. Product Specification:Battery type: Lithium polymerCapacity: 3.7V/ 3,600mAhUSB cable input: 5V/1AOutput:  USB port: 5V/1AOutput:  Apple dock: 5V/1A Output:  Micro USB cable: 5V/1AOn/off button: press to start chargingPower display: 5 LED indicators shows power level, each represents 20%
of battery usageSize: 65mm x 108mm x 15mm
Weight:125g






Product Features


Fit for iPhone design
3,600mAh Lithium
polymer battery, can charge iPhone 180%, iPad 40%
No boundary limit, used as stand of iPhond & iPad
Output with Apple
dock and USB port, suit for all mobile phone and iPhone/iPad
USB input & Micro
USB output cables incorporated
UV coating









What Your Contribution Will Fund
With your support, we can put TOTAL ENERGY LINE into people’s hands worldwide. Your contribution will help lessen the overall production costs. The more you order in bulk, the more we can cut the production cost, hence the better value for money.


* FAQ
1) What is the capacity of one kit?
Solar Panel 5.5V
/ 5.6V
Max output 5V /
1A
Battery: 3,600mAh
Output: 
USB port: 5V/1AOutput:  Apple dock: 5V/1AOutput:  Micro USB cable: 5V/1A
2) How many mobile phones can be connected to the set?
You can connect 3 different devices at the same time.
3) How long does the kit effectiveness last?
The solar panel looses 10% of its production after 20 years
The battery can be recharged over 500 times
